speeches_EN: Good morning to all; Thank you, thank you very much to all for being here: there are two weeks of campaign and it seemed to me that it made sense that we had this conversation with those who are candidates, with the usual friends, thanks Axel for being here, just in front; Thanks to all those who accompany me from the cabinet, thanks to all the mayors, thanks for being here, because I wanted, in these two weeks, we all be clear about what I think we have to tell the Argentines and the Argentines. It seems to me that it is time to get attention, after so much noise that they have made, see that we are clear about what we did and why we are doing. This morning, he looked that yesterday the opposition took a statement saying that they have no position to dialogue with the government, that they do not want to dialogue with the government, because there are two country models in struggle. It is the first time, that I agree with them, there are two country models in struggle, it is clearly so, they have all the reason for the world. First time I share one hundred percent what they say. There is a country, which we represent, which is a country that believes in a present state, which believes in equally state, that deems deeply in democracy, deeply in the institutions of the Republic; And there is another country that does not believe social justice, there is another country that believes that each one must be saved alone and that is why they speak so much of merit and meritocracy; There is another country that fills your mouth talking about the Republic, but judicial tables armed to pursue opponents; There is another country, which generated the greatest economic decline, which we remember, that is the indebtedness we live and the obligation to pay it over time, which they proposed, the two things. Sometimes I think - I speak it many times with Axel - that when that, December 10, we arrived at the government we did not expect to face these management problems. We had a great illusion, we were very clear about what we had to do, we knew that we had to solve an immense debt, we knew that it was not only a debt, which I had to resolve, in national terms, it was a debt that Axel had to resolve in its province, because to the province they borrowed it with the same logic that borrowed the country, exactly the same. We knew that this was a very serious condition to think about the progress and development of the country, we also knew the postponement in which the small and medium -sized companies were, how much employment had entered into crisis because when 23,000 companies were closed what all that generated was to push people to informality and poverty or unemployment directly. And we knew we had to work, first of all, for them. I remember that December 10, first ... the last, he said. And the truth is that we act accordingly. And all we did was not by chance, it was because we were convinced of what we should do. In those first three months of normal we had, the only three months of normality, in Argentina, which we govern we improve many things. In fact, the real salary had grown 6 points, after having fallen 20, in the years of macrismo; It happened that the pandemic came and those 6 points, which we had achieved we lost them again. But as when the pandemia appeared we also faced the debate of the two countries: of which we believed that taking care was the most important, and of those who said: "That each one is saved as they can and let's not let the economy stop." There were also two countries in struggles, two faced countries. And we face the care of our people, we face the care of our people knowing that we came from a very complex scenario. Keep in mind, you, that the Ministry of Health had disappeared; Keep in mind, that - in the Customs sheds - vaccines were overcome, which you had bought; Keep in mind that measles had returned, in Argentina, a disease that we believed eradicated; Keep in mind that they had abandoned the public hospital. And what we did What was it? Put the standing state, present, precisely to level all those falls, which they had generated. And we achieve what we achieved; Here no more in the killing, not so close, there we finished building two hospitals - which had left half to do, abandoned - as we did with those hospitals we did it with many others. And when the hospitals, which we built did not reach, we began to carry modular hospitals, about thirty modular hospitals, distributed throughout this country and when those did not reach the hospitals of the Armed Forces and lift the hospitals of the Armed Forces, in different corners of the country to serve Argentines and Argentine. And you had to create beds, you had to put beds, you had to put automatic respirators. So, we discovered that - in Córdoba - there was an automatic respirators factory, which had practically its production, sold abroad. And we prohibit exports, so that these respirators remain, in Argentina, bought by the State so that Argentines and Argentines had it, when they will need it. And I will always thank the owners of that factory, because they understood the moment and commitment that was lived and multiplied production by three, they made three shifts working permanently to make the respirators that Argentina needed. And so we ride - with Axel, too - here in Buenos Aires working side by side; with Daniel, who also had to do with all this; With Ginés that helped a lot in the construction of all this. . Thus we ride more than 3,000 intensive therapy beds and distribute automatic respirators to each corner of Argentina, which required it. And the pandemic came and hundreds of thousands of people and tranquility were infected, which we have left is that none of them lacked the medical care that required, because we put a state in motion so that health is to the access of those who needed it. We could not avoid deaths, and each of those deaths hurt us, but no one was abandoned without medical attention. In these days we have known what the World Health Organization calls the "studies of excess deaths" and we discovered, that in Argentina, we computed absolutely all deaths by Covid, which existed and that in many other countries the numbers did not close, because many more died, than those that identified, those same countries, as deaths from Covid. We work hard and preserve the life of Argentines and Argentines. One day, while all this was happening, we realized that Argentina had to continue working and we realized that the economy closed, the SMEs closed and the works fell and there we went with the ATP to help millions of workers and we held the formal work and we held many SMEs. We did it because we were convinced that the day that the instant of the pandemic had to quickly produce and stand up to Argentina. We needed those SMEs to open so that the workers could enter and continue working as they had done the last day and the policy worked. It was no accident, huh. It was what we calculate and that is why you see what is being seen now. That is why it is seen that industrial activity grows as it grows; That economic activity grows as it grows, so it is seen that investments grow as they grow. To be able to face the pandemic, which until today, does not have a remedy with what to deal with that infection we knew that the vaccine was very important and we went to look for, to all corners of the world, where vaccines existed. They accused us of endless things, but there by December, of 2020, we are among the first countries, which began to vaccinate their citizens. . We went and bought vaccines in Russia, in China, in Oxford, in the United States, and each negotiation, which we assumed - with the laboratories - we made it preserving the rights of Argentina and not subjecting the country at risk, which out there - tomorrow - became regrets. And the result do you know what it is? That I told them, that in August, we were going to vaccinate 7 million people, who needed the second dose, and yesterday 7 million people received the second dose, in Argentina. And the vaccination rhythm continues, does not stop, do not stop, because I am not going to stop until the last Argentine or Argentina has received the doses of the vaccines it needs so as not to get infected in these times of pandemic. We did not do it by chance, we did it because the care of our people is deeply rooted in us; It was no accident that we preserve - with ATP - work and production; We did it because it is in our genes to take care of work and production. It was no accident that we worked by giving loans to the monotributistas, so that they can cope with the difficult moment to which the pandemic forced them to live, we did it because we believe in the work of each one and of each of those monotributistas, it was not by chance. And it is no coincidence, now, that we are with the very advanced vaccination process, again living the life we ​​want. It is no accident, that we are carrying out promotional actions so that the economy grows very strongly. We know that there are sectors more hurt by the pandemic, than others; We know that many had to close their bar, their little kiosk, we know that tourism has resent and take out the pre-viaje, for the second time. Matías told me, that we took that second pre-viaje and demand, in the agencies, increased 500 percent and Argentina- this year, it will fly from tourism and welcome, that after so much pain we bring the enjoyment, welcome. And welcome because we are preserving sources of work, in hotels, in restaurants, which also worry us. Everything that happened did not happen by chance, it happened because this country is governed by people who believe that the first is the human being, work, production, knowledge, public education, public health and the present state, which are all necessary conditions to achieve the development of a society and we are convinced, we do not disguise ourselves for this moment to take care of people. We have always taken care of it. We do not come to defend the State now when others incinerated it, we always take care of it, we do not come to preserve the workers when others recommended that they reconvera and become entrepreneurs, we always take care of the Argentine work. We do not come to take care of SMEs, after others closed 23 thousand small and medium enterprises, we always take care of SMEs. We do not come to wish, after others borrowed us, although unfortunately it is our design. We come to wish ourselves because we are convinced that the debt is a strong conditioning for our development and if they want a test we could do everything we did because we stopped paying the private creditors that we had an obligation to pay them for what Macri had signed. And there the resources appeared to be able to allocate to health, to education, to everything that was needed. Now, a different time has already started. I always said the exit door is there, we crossed that door and now we have to solve what the way we are going to choose. Because if the Argentines are wrong, we have no memory of what happened two years ago, not what happened 20, of what happened two years ago. We can take where they say health was not a priority, I do not say it they say it, public health was not a priority. We can undertake a path where public education some have the misfortune of falling, I do not say it they say it. We can fall into a path where universities must be ..., they must stop opening because the children of the workers have no chance of studying, I do not say it, they say it. We can fall into a system that says: "Well, as I have fiscal deficit I have no choice but to borrow at 100 billion dollars," I don't say so. We can take a path where those who govern us invite us to fall in love with the International Monetary Fund, I do not say it. And what do I want? And what do we all want? Honor what we did in this year and a half with enormous effort that was to preserve the lives of Argentines, preserve production, preserve employment and now make Argentina take off so that, Argentina, stands at once and forever for more production and for more work and for more investment. That is the way I ask the Argentines to take. Today I am here to commit once again to each Argentine and every Argentina, convinced that now we will be able to do what we dream of Axel, what we dream of Cristina, now. Now that there are 1,800 public works distributed throughout the country, which when we arrived were paralyzed. Now that with Jorge in a year and a half we delivered 20 thousand homes when they in four delivered 10 thousand, now the time of growth arrived. Now that all Argentines and all Argentines know that there are 100,000 homes, which are being built, from here at the end of the year, that will generate 300 thousand jobs, now the time came. Those who live here know that Aysa has 2 thousand works in progress throughout Greater Buenos Aires, which mean more drinking water and better sewage networks for those who live here. That the budget increased 7 times, with respect, of 2019; Works that were paralyzed, works that were not done, a work that worried us because people care, simply for that. Along the way we also did several things that in the maelstrom did not pay attention, but on the way we ended with an 11 -year debate in Argentina and those who live in a salary stopped paying the income tax. And along the way we ask the great Argentine fortunes to make a contribution, which meant an income to the fiscal coffers exceeding 260 billion pesos and with this money we are giving many neighborhoods deprived the urbanity they did not have. And we put personal assets again and those who have the most pay. And we change the profit regime and the largest companies do not pay the same as an SME. And we did not by chance, we did it thinking at this time. The moment when everything returned to normal. It is a shame to think that so much effort that we have made so much that we take care of them can fall the sack broken by the song of sirens of those who mistreated us in public education, those who mistreated us in education, which mistreated us in science and technology, which facilitated financial timba, which ended with production and those that destroyed work. As an empire of these things that are said, today, I am a puppet and I am an authoritarian, I do not know how it combines with both things, but they say. But the truth is that I have not reached the presidency of the nation, first alone, I arrived accompanied by a set of men and women who have a common denominator, which is that which I am talking about, we believe in the present state, we believe in public education, we believe in public health, we believe in private investment, in productive investment, at work and social development, we believe in all that. And so, we don't have to explain what we did as others do. Now, they are fighting to see who is the candidate who was not in the previous government, that is not our problem. We know that whenever we act, we act in defense of those who were worse, of the most needy, of the most forgotten. We did a lot this year, a lot; I just talked about profits, and said that now the largest companies, the ones that invoice the most, pay more profits, but I also have to say that the income tax was stopped paying to those who worked, and that we did that during the pandemic. And in the pandemic we do not stop expanding rights, and we dictate the law of the IVE, the law of the thousand days, we continue to open gender equality, we carry the non -binary documentation, we deliver the 1,000 DNI to a person without gender identity that she recognized. We have not stopped creating rights, we have done a lot, and we still have much to do, we take care of the health of the Argentines, we achieve the necessary vaccines, we move forward in an important vaccination process, we still have the debate with the fund, which we will continue to discuss, that we will try to find an agreement, but that everyone knows that this agreement can not be paid by the Argentine people, because the Argentine people have already paid too much the damage of those who seemed too much. I ask you that in these two weeks that remain with the militant force that our strength always had, we are the policy in its very essence, we do not renegate politics, we know that it is the instrument to change a society, we do not talk about freedoms and we add to the blows on duty, we do not do any of that. I ask that with that militant force of each of you these two weeks come out to generate an explosion of trust in the Argentines, because we have all the possibilities of building that Argentina that we dream there in December 2019, and it is not far from being achieved, what is possible is that if they decide to take the other way, it is possible that everything is more difficult, because they do not want that Argentina save yourself, and leave your fate that is not right. And all the effort will have been in vain. I am very convinced, I see it, how we are going, I want us to finish convincing Argentines who doubt, simply, we have no space to doubt, we are living a world that has turned around, we are living a world that reviews everything that has happened, nobody has certainties in the world, but we do have certainty, we are certain that we are not going to claudicate in our policy; We are certain that we are going to be loyal to what we think, even when some weigh. Today I read a tweet - of the "Cuervo" - that said: "Alberto punishes him for not having betrayed Cristina", I am not going to betray Cristina, I will not betray Máximo, I will not betray Massa, I will not betray any of you and I will not betray the people who voted for me, I will not do it, I will not do it. And I am that everyone I named and all of you are not going to betray your classmates, I am sure of that, I am sure that everyone will put the best for you to get ahead, I am sure of all this. They do not forgive me that I have promoted this unit that I enjoy so much. Nor do they forgive me that Internet connectivity, television cable or cell phone cable have turned into a public service, but know that what they see in certain channels and what they see in certain newspapers and what they listen to certain radios is the result that we have set the hand in their pocket in favor of the Argentines, seize it! At this point of the events no stage bends me and no commentator of reality changes me in the essence, I can listen to them, because sometimes they are right, and I can correct something that we are doing wrong, but I know that all this I am talking about, which is the deepest thing about our policy, than the essence of what we do, that will not change. We have to build another country, once and for all, when we saw with Santiago yesterday how much we had given the provinces this year and a half, above the co -participation that corresponds to it, I realize that when I said that I was going to do a federal country I am fulfilling it, because that money has reached all the provinces, even to the opponents, which received very high percentages, because its inhabitants needed it, simply. He looked at the Mendoza case, without going any further. I ask that these two weeks, with a lot of conviction, very strongly, we go out to demonstrate what we are essence, we are a movement that went out to defend the dispossessed, those who had no voice. In this time of pandemic let's tell them all that we are to give them the voice that the pandemic has taken them; We are here to hold their hands and raise them to those who have fallen, that they are today our first responsibility, and let's do it with the joy of always. The truth, jokes apart, we are a movement that loves people, where love does not complicate life, on the contrary, it makes us happy. Nobody saves alone, says our Pope Francis, and also said Perón when he requested that the community organize so as not to leave each of the inhabitants free. I ask you to take the militancy to the street and show in Argentina that we are to govern the time we need so that Argentina once and forever changes, we go once and forever to live the life we ​​want. Thank you all and all

topics_ES: Palabras del presidente de la Nación, Alberto Fernández, en el Acto de Conmemoración del 243° Aniversario del Nacimiento del Gral. José de San Martín
speeches_ES:
Buen día a todos y todas.
Muchas gracias, querido Gobernador de Corrientes, por hacerme partícipe de este homenaje; gracias queridos gobernadores de nuestro norte grande; gracias al Regimiento de Granaderos. Empiezo por pedir perdón porque esta ceremonia se dilató en el tiempo porque vengo de México y no quería estar ausente. Y porque ustedes tuvieron la deferencia de atender a mis ganas de estar presente hoy y postergaron un rato largo el encuentro. Lo primero que quiero pedirles es disculpas y darles las gracias por la tolerancia (APLUSOS). Vengo de celebrar con los mexicanos los 200 años del Plan de Iguala. México tiene una historia muy parecida a la Argentina. En 1810, igual que en Buenos Aires, los porteños nos rebelamos a la corona española, ellos allí vieron el grito de Dolores con dos sacerdotes a la cabeza educados por los Jesuitas. Hidalgo, el más importante, Morela quien lo acompañaba, lucharon para darle a México la libertad que no tenía, eran parte del Virreinato de la nueva España que se extendía hasta territorios que hoy son norteamericanos y hasta países que hoy son países de Centro América. Lo intentaron y no pudieron. Morela terminó fusilado en 1815, pero otros levantaron las banderas de Hidalgo, entre ellos un sureño de México, Guerrero, que le hizo la vida imposible al representante del rey en México hasta obligarlo a acordar una salida. Esa salida fue lo que se conoció como el Plan de Iguala, que dio lugar a la actual bandera mexicana, que tiene tres colores. Uno de ellos representa la independencia y la igualdad, otro color representa la unidad de los mexicanos, y esa franja blanca representa la religión, que en aquellos años tenía un peso superlativo, tan superlativo que los Jesuitas que habían educado a los dos primeros emancipadores de México, Hidalgo y Morela. Ayer me tocó hablar en un acto que mi querido amigo el presidente, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, tuvo la deferencia de hacerme participar de un homenaje tan inmenso como es recordar 200 años del comienzo de la independencia de un país tan maravilloso culturalmente, tan enorme social y económicamente como México. Pero cuando me tocó hablar, amén de rendir tributo a Guerrero y a verdaderos artífices de la independencia mexicana, no pude dejar de pensar en que hubo un tiempo en nuestra América donde hubo otros más al sur que también levantaron la bandera de la independencia, la bandera de la libertad, la bandera de la justicia, la bandera de la igualdad, y se animaron contra otros que querían dominarnos, que nos dominaban y nos querían seguir haciéndolo. Hablaba ayer con Andrés Manuel, cuando dejamos el acto e íbamos a un segundo acto, que habíamos vivido también nosotros, en el México presente y en Argentina presente, un tiempo en donde pareciera ser que quienes gobernaban preferían borrar la historia. Y le contaba una anécdota que ocurrió en Tucumán, mi querido Juan, donde un Presidente le dijo al actual rey de España “piense usted lo angustiados que habrán estado nuestro libertadores cuando tuvieron que declarar la independencia”: yo no me lo imagino a San Martin angustiado, no me lo imagino a Belgrano angustiado, yo no me imagino a Güemes angustiado. No me lo imagino al Chacho Peñaloza, a Facundo Quiroga, a Felipe Varela. No me lo imagino angustiado a Ariel Martín Güemes, el único general del Ejército Argentino que murió en una batalla. No me imagino la angustia de ellos. No la tuvieron. Lo que tuvieron fue coraje, eso sí tuvieron, coraje que pocos tienen, pero es el coraje de esos poco lo que hace posible los grandes cambios, lo que hace posible las trasformaciones Yapeyú, igual que Hidalgo, fue educado por los Jesuitas, allí están los restos que quedan de su casa, de acá salió, se fue a estudiar a España y volvió a servir a un Ejército de una Nación que todavía no lo era y quería serlo, y fundó este maravilloso Ejército, el Ejército de los Granaderos. No solo fue un militar, fue un hombre inmenso, ¡inmenso!, que tuvo la capacidad de inyectar fuerza donde la fuerza no aparecía.
En aquellos años no bastó con San Martín, necesitamos de muchos otros, necesitamos de alguien que era un abogado como yo, al que un día la historia le dijo cárgate un uniforme, agarrá un fusil, ponételo al hombro y andá a defender el norte argentino, con eso solo se fue a dar batalla, se llamaba Manuel Belgrano, otro hombre inmenso que dio la Argentina. Y allá en su lucha por evitar que desde el norte ingresen los Realistas, se encontró con un hombre que, honestamente, era parte del Patriciado salteño, pero que había decidido unirse a sus gauchos para pelear contra el Ejército Realista, que quería recuperar para España las tierras que eran nuestras: ese fue Don Miguel Martín de Güemes, un coraje impresionante, una fuerza increíble, un valor incalculable. Murió peleando, como mueren los soldados. San Martín, que además fue un inmenso estratega -como bien marcó el Gobernador- tuvo que idear otra forma de atacar al Ejército Realista que avanzaba desde el norte, y encontró aliados. Hizo una proeza que es considerada en el mundo militar como un acto de estrategia único: cruzar Los Andes para llegar a Chile, abrazarse a O’Higgins y liberar Chile. Pero no le alcanzó, se dio cuenta que hacía falta más. Y así fue hacia el norte, en Bolivia peleaba Sucre, y llegó al Perú y también ayudó para la libertad de Perú. Y cuando vinieron los peruanos y le dijeron “usted debe gobernarnos”, él dijo “no, ustedes deben gobernarse”, y renunció a todos los honores, y siguió su marcha, y más al norte protagonizó el histórico abrazo con Simón Bolívar.
Hubo un tiempo en que en nuestra América existieron esos hombres, no existían miserias, existían miserables, los miserables han existido siempre, para mal de la humanidad, pero había una generación de hombres y de mujeres que estaban dispuestos a dar esa pelea. Macacha Güemes formaba parte del esfuerzo de Don Miguel Martín de Güemes; Juana Azurduy se animó a ponerse en armas, como mujer que era.
Yo creo que en estos tiempos difíciles que nos tocan pasar, porque la vida es dinámica y a veces nos enfrenta a hechos inesperados, como tener que enfrentar una pandemia, y cuando a veces sentimos que el esfuerzo que ponemos, el Gobierno Nacional, por ir a buscar vacunas en el mundo para ponerle tranquilidad, salud a nuestros compatriotas, y vemos que se enredan en discusiones y en debates que no son lo importante, porque nadie vino a mí a decirme hice una gestión en China para conseguir una vacuna; hice una gestión en los Estados Unidos para conseguir una vacuna; hice una gestión en Inglaterra para conseguir una vacuna, nadie vino a ofrecernos, lo debimos hacer solos, en la compañía de estos gobernadores y de los que no están también, todos trabajamos codo a codo para darle salud a nuestra gente. Y cuando siento que en los diarios, que en la televisión, que en las redes generan debates que por momentos nos obligan a desatender lo importante, pienso que aquellos enormes hombres del 1.800 no tenían que enfrentar esa adversidad que es luchar contra la prédica malintencionada, contra las voces altivas que se levantan y se olvidan lo que hicieron cuando tuvieron que trabajar por los argentinos.
Y a veces seguramente muchos de nosotros nos preguntamos cómo seguimos, a mí me pasa, soy un ser humano, ¿pero saben en quién pienso? Pienso en San Martín, pienso en Belgrano, pienso en Güemes, pienso en Rosas, pienso en Quiroga. El secreto sigue siendo el mismo, en un tiempo en que en Santa Fe Estanislao López sentía que no podía y expresó su desazón al General San Martín, y el General San Martín le dijo “no afloje, no desfallezca, juntos somos invencibles”.
A nosotros nos toca enfrentar un mundo muy raro, muy egoísta, donde el diez por ciento de los países concentran el noventa por ciento las vacunas, pero no bajamos los brazos, seguimos buscándolas, están llegando hoy, en el Día del General San Martín, y permítanme, en el día que nació Néstor, feliz cumpleaños Néstor, dónde estés. Hoy están llegando un millón de vacunas chinas, el fin de semana seguramente tendremos más que la Federación Rusa nos está dando. Recibimos hace unos días y recibiremos más en cuanto comience marzo, vacunas de AstraZenica. Cuando quieren hacerme claudicar yo pienso en San Martín. Yo no voy a ser nunca como él, pero quiero que algo de él me inspire, que algo de él, que algo de Belgrano, que algo de Güemes, que algo de Quiroga, que algo de Rosas, que algo de Artigas, que algo de Bolívar, que algo de O’Higgins, que algo de Sucre, quiero que algo de todos ellos me inspire, y ahí me surge recordar a San Martín y su carta a Estanislao López, “unidos somos invencibles”. Esa unidad supone darnos cuenta de las asimetrías y de las injusticias que vive la Argentina. Fíjense ustedes recién el Gobernador hizo mención, con toda razón, a la importancia de recuperar la educación en la Argentina. Cuando uno habla de educación está hablando del futuro, porque las sociedades ricas son las sociedades que desarrollan la inteligencia, y la pandemia nos demostró el nivel de desigualdad que hay en nuestra Argentina, tiene razón lo que dice el Gobernador. La conectividad a internet se ha desarrollado, pero se ha desarrollado donde es negocio, donde no es negocio no se ha desarrollado del mismo modo, y con eso dejamos a millones de pequeños argentinos sin poder aprender. Y cuando uno dice frente a semejante dato que la conectividad debe dejar de ser un negocio privado y ser un servicio público, hay algunos sinvergüenzas que se animan a cuestionarlo. Miren: yo tengo vergüenza y no voy a dejar que los chicos argentinos no tengan educación para que algunos hagan sus mejores negocios, los mejores negocios de unos pocos es el dolor de millones de argentinos, y no voy a dejar que eso ocurra, pueden dedicarme las tapas que quieran, no voy a dejar que eso ocurra, y no debemos dejar que eso ocurra, porque si dejamos que eso ocurra, el Norte Argentino seguirá sumido en la postergación en la que está, parte de un país, donde el centro concentra la riqueza y distribuye pobreza al norte y al sur, ¿quién quiere esa Argentina? ¿Esa es la Argentina que soñó San Martín? ¿Esa es la Argentina que soñó Belgrano? Seriamente nadie quiere esa Argentina, y el norte, particularmente el norte, ha sido una y otra vez olvidado, y el olvido precisamente genera consecuencias como las que el gobernador Valdés ha dicho. Yo no quiero ver más emigrar chicos de Yapeyú para buscar suerte en Buenos Aires, quiero que en Yapeyú encuentren la educación que necesitan, que tengan la conectividad necesaria, porque hoy internet es lo que fue la biblioteca en el siglo XIX o en el siglo XX; quiero que acá esos chicos tengan educación, que sus padres y abuelas tengan la salud pública que merecen, quiero que aquí encuentren trabajo, quiero que vivan felices de haber nacido en Yapeyú, quiero que construyan sus familias, quiero que disfruten de su tierra, y quiero que un día se mueran en su tierra, felices después de haber vivido en ella, pero eso no lo vamos a hacer si a la Argentina no la integramos definitivamente. Eso es un país federal, el federalismo no se declama, el federalismo se hace. Y quiero decirle, querido Gobernador, que hoy estoy aquí porque no quiero faltar a mi compromiso. Vivimos en una tierra todavía desintegrada, el día que ese arco se complete, la Argentina estará integrada, porque Malvinas será parte de la Argentina definitivamente. Y para integrar la Argentina también tenemos que integrar a este norte, que es políticamente parte de la Argentina, pero que es tratado como territorio ajeno, y no lo merece la gente del norte. Yo estoy aquí porque asumí un compromiso con el Norte Argentino, y lo voy a cumplir, pero estoy aquí también para que no nos olvidemos, en los momentos que nos duelan, que San Martín nunca se angustió, que fue un hombre inmenso, que como él hubo inmensos hombres e inmensas mujeres que acompañaron esta gesta, que Bolívar tuvo a Manuela Sanz para poder llevar adelante su gesta, no nos olvidemos, porque San Martín todos los días debe inyectarnos las fuerzas que a veces flaquea. ¡Viva San Martín, viva Yapeyú, viva Corrientes, viva el Norte Grande y viva la Argentina y viva la América Latina unida! ¡Gracias a todos y a todas!
topics_EN: Words of the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández, in the act of commemoration of the 243 ° Anniversary of the Birth of Gral. José de San Martín
speeches_EN:
Good morning to all.
Thank you very much, dear governor of Corrientes, for making me participate in this tribute; Thanks dear governors of our Grande northern; Thanks to the Grenadier Regiment. I begin to apologize because this ceremony was expanding in time because I come from Mexico and did not want to be absent. And because you had the deference to attend to my desire to be present today and postponed the meeting for a long time. The first thing I want to ask for is apologies and thank them for tolerance (applause). I have been celebrating the 200 years of the Iguala Plan with the Mexicans. Mexico has a history very similar to Argentina. In 1810, as in Buenos Aires, the Buenos Aires rebel the Spanish crown, they saw the shout of pains with two priests at the head educated by the Jesuits. Hidalgo, the most important, Morela who accompanied him, fought to give Mexico the freedom that he did not have, were part of the Viceroyalty of New Spain that extended to territories that are now Americans and even countries that are now countries in Central America. They tried and they couldn't. Morela ended up shot in 1815, but others built the flags of Hidalgo, including a southern Mexico, Guerrero, who made life impossible for the king's representative in Mexico until they forced him to agree on an exit. That exit was what was known as the Iguala Plan, which gave rise to the current Mexican flag, which has three colors. One of them represents independence and equality, another color represents the unity of Mexicans, and that white strip represents religion, which in those years had a superlative weight, so superlative that the Jesuits who had educated the first two emancipators of Mexico, Hidalgo and Morela. Yesterday I had to speak in an act that my dear friend, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, had the deference of making me participate in a tribute as immense as it is to remember 200 years of the beginning of the independence of a country as wonderful culturally, as huge socially and economically as Mexico. But when I had to speak, in addition to paying tribute to Guerrero and true architects of Mexican independence, I could not stop thinking that there was a time in our America where there were others to the south that also raised the flag of independence, the flag of freedom, the flag of justice, the flag of equality, and were encouraged against others who wanted to dominate us, that they dominated us and they wanted to continue us. He spoke yesterday with Andrés Manuel, when we left the act and we were going to a second act, which we had also lived in the present and present Argentina, a time where it seems that those who ruled preferred to erase the story. And he told him an anecdote that happened in Tucumán, my dear Juan, where a president told the current king of Spain “Think of the distressed that our Libertadores will have been when they had to declare independence”: I do not imagine it to San Martin Angustiado, I do not imagine it to Belgrano Angustiado, I do not imagine Güemes anguished. I can't imagine Chacho Peñaloza, Facundo Quiroga, Felipe Varela. I can't imagine Ariel Martín Güemes, the only general of the Argentine army who died in a battle. I can't imagine their anguish. They did not have it. What they had was courage, they did, courage that few have, but it is the courage of those little that makes the great changes possible, which makes possible the Yapeyú transformations, just like Hidalgo, it was educated by the Jesuits, there are the remains that remain from their home, from here it came out, went to study in Spain and served an army again of a nation that was still and did not want to be army of grenadiers. Not only was he a military man, he was an immense man, immense! He had the ability to inject strength where force did not appear.
In those years it was not enough with San Martín, we need many others, we need someone who was a lawyer like me, to which one day the story told him a uniform, he will grab a rifle, put him on his shoulder and go to defend the northern Argentine, with that he only went to battle, he was called Manuel Belgrano, another immense man that Argentina gave. And there in his struggle to prevent the realists from entering from the north, he met a man who, honestly, was part of Patriciate Salta, but who had decided to join his gauchos to fight against the realistic army, who wanted to recover for Spain the lands that were ours: that was Don Miguel Martín de Güemes, an impressive courage, an incredible force, an incalculable value. He died fighting, as soldiers die. San Martín, who was also an immense strategist - as well marked the governor - had to devise another way to attack the realistic army that advanced from the north, and found allies. He made a feat that is considered in the military world as an act of unique strategy: cross the Andes to get to Chile, hug O'Higgins and free Chile. But he did not reach him, he realized that more was needed. And so he went north, in Bolivia fought Sucre, and arrived in Peru and also helped for Peru's freedom. And when the Peruvians came and told you "you must govern us," he said "no, you must govern", and renounced all the honors, and followed his march, and further north starred in the historic hug with Simón Bolívar.
There was a time when these men existed in our America, there were no miseries, there were miserable, the miserable ones have always existed, for the evil of humanity, but there was a generation of men and women who were willing to give that fight. Macacha Güemes was part of Don Miguel Martín de Güemes; Juana Azurduy was encouraged to get in arms, as she was a woman.
I believe that in these difficult times that we have to pass, because life is dynamic and sometimes faces us of unexpected facts, such as having to face a pandemic, and when sometimes we feel that the effort we put, the national government, for going to look for vaccines in the world to put tranquility, health to our compatriots, and we see that they get entangled in discussions and in debates that are not important, because no one came to me to tell me. ; I did a management in the United States to get a vaccine; I did a management in England to get a vaccine, nobody came to offer us, we had to do it alone, in the company of these governors and those who are not also, we all work side by side to give health to our people. And when I feel that in the newspapers, that on television, which in the networks generate debates that at times force us to disregard the important thing, I think that those huge men of the 1,800 did not have to face that adversity that is to fight against the malicious preaching, against the haughty voices that rise and forget what they did when they had to work for the Argentines.
And sometimes many of us surely ask ourselves how we follow, I am a human being, but do they know who I think? I think of San Martín, I think of Belgrano, I think of Güemes, I think of Rosas, I think of Quiroga. The secret remains the same, at a time when in Santa Fe Estanislao López felt that he could not and expressed his unease to General San Martín, and General San Martín said "not loosen, do not faint, together we are invincible."
We have to face a very rare, very selfish world, where ten percent of the countries concentrate ninety percent of vaccines, but we do not lower our arms, we are still looking for them, they are arriving today, on the day of General San Martín, and allow me, on the day Nestor was born, happy birthday Néstor, where you are. Today there are a million Chinese vaccines, the weekend we will surely have more than the Russian Federation is giving us. We received a few days ago and we will receive more as soon as March begins, Astrazenica vaccines. When they want to make me claudicar I think of San Martín. I am never going to be like him, but I want something of him to inspire me, that something of him, that some of Belgrano, that some of Güemes, that some of Quiroga, that some of Rosas, that some of Artigas, that some of Bolívar, that some of O'Higgins, that some of Sucre, I want something of all of them to inspire me, and there it arises to remember me to San Martín and his letter to Saint Martin. That unit involves realizing the asymmetries and injustices that Argentina lives. You look at the governor, mentioned, with all reason, to the importance of recovering education in Argentina. When one speaks of education, he is talking about the future, because rich societies are the societies that develop intelligence, and pandemic showed us the level of inequality in our Argentina, what the governor says. Internet connectivity has developed, but it has developed where it is business, where it is not business has not developed in the same way, and with that we leave millions of small Argentines without learning. And when one says in front of such data that connectivity must cease to be a private business and be a public service, there are some scoundrels that are encouraged to question it. Look: I am shame and I will not let the Argentine boys have no education so that some do their best businesses, the best businesses of a few is the pain of millions of Argentines, and I will not let that happen, they can dedicate the tapas they want, I will not let that happen, and we should not let that happen, because if we let that happen, the north Argentina will continue to be in the postpone Wealth and distributes poverty to the north and south, who wants that Argentina? Is that Argentina who dreamed San Martín? Is that Argentina that Belgrano dreamed? Seriously nobody wants that Argentina, and the north, particularly the north, has been forgotten again and again, and oblivion precisely generates consequences such as those that Governor Valdés has said. I do not want to see more yapeyú boys to look for luck in Buenos Aires, I want Yapeyú to find the education they need, to have the necessary connectivity, because today the Internet is what the library was in the 19th century or in the twentieth century; I want those boys here to have education, that their parents and grandmothers have the public health they deserve, I want them to find work here, I want them to live happy to have been born in Yapeyú, I want their families to build, I want them to enjoy their land, and I want one day to die in their land, happy after having lived in it, but we are not going to do that if we definitely do not integrate it. That is a federal country, federalism is not declined, federalism is done. And I want to tell him, dear governor, that today I am here because I don't want to miss my commitment. We live in a land still disintegrated, the day that arch is completed, Argentina will be integrated, because Malvinas will definitely be part of Argentina. And to integrate Argentina we also have to integrate this north, which is politically part of Argentina, but which is treated as foreign territory, and the people of the north do not deserve it. I am here because I assumed a commitment to the North Argentina, and I will fulfill it, but I am also here so that we do not forget, in the moments that hurt us, that San Martín never got distraught, that he was an immense man, who, like him, there were immense men and immense women who accompanied this deed, that Bolívar had Manuela Sanz to be able to carry out his deed, let's not forget, because San Martin must not forget the forces. Long live San Martín, Viva Yapeyú, Viva Corrientes, Long live the big north and live Argentina and live the United Latin America! Thank you to all!

topics_ES: Palabras del Presidente de la Nación, Alberto Fernández durante su reunión con representantes de las uniones industriales del NEA y el NOA y dirigentes sindicales, en San Javier, provincia de Tucumán.
speeches_ES:
Muy bien, muchas gracias a todos y todas, gracias Juan por tus palabras, siempre es lindo volver a Tucumán, lindísimo este lugar, aunque las nubes no nos dejan ver la belleza del lugar, pero uno la presume y muy feliz de estar acá, en un momento singular, de la Argentina. Como bien decía Juan todo lo que nos tocó pasar, todo lo que debimos enfrentar cuando nosotros, en marzo, ahí con Matías, con Martín veíamos los primeros datos de que la economía empezaba a funcionar y ya estábamos muy alentados con la idea de que estábamos enciendo la economía – como decía en campaña – cayó la pandemia y la pandemia no es que nos afecto a nosotros sólo, dio vuelta al mundo, cambió toda la realidad del mundo. Y apareció, de repente, otra urgencia, en un escenario tan penoso, como el escenario económico que habíamos recibido, el escenario penoso – en este caso – era el sistema sanitario argentino, que había sido abandonado absolutamente, por los que gobernaron antes que nosotros, que hasta había eliminado el ministerio de Salud, que había dejado vencer vacunas, en los galpones de la Aduana. Nosotros nos dimos un plan preservando la salud de los argentinos. Ahora ¿cómo se puede preservar la salud de los argentinos, en una pandemia? Del modo que lo hicimos: garantizando que ningún argentino se quede sin salud; después sabíamos que enfrentábamos un virus, que cuando afectaba a los adultos, a los mayores, se volvía letal y era muy difícil evitarlo y hoy cuando miramos los resultados para atrás nos damos cuenta que ese era un dato cierto, porque el promedio de edad de quienes han fallecido por este virus es de 74 años. Y a ellos nos dedicamos a cuidarles todo lo que pudimos y advertimos la complejidad, la dificultad y el riesgo que corrían en la pandemia, pero la mayor preocupación que teníamos es que no nos pase lo que habíamos visto ocurrir, en Europa y en muchos países de Latinoamérica, que es que los ciudadanos llegaban en busca de atención médica, a los hospitales y los hospitales no tenían donde recibirlos. Y en tiempo récord tuvimos que poner en marcha y tuvimos que construir hospitales, que habían quedado a medio hacer. Entonces, pusimos en marcha una cantidad de hospitales modulares, que construimos a velocidad increíble, en distintos lugares del país y así logramos que 3.600 camas, unidad de terapia intensiva se incorporen al sistema de salud, y así logramos que ningún argentino, que se haya enfermado por coronavirus, haya ido a un hospital y el nosocomio le haya dicho: “yo no tengo como atenderle”. Y eso a nosotros nos da una gran tranquilidad. También descubrimos – de repente – que había un aparato imprescindible para atendernos, en esta situación, que se llama respirador automático, y que el mundo no tenía y descubrimos, que – en la Argentina – dos hermanos cordobeses: un ingeniero y un médico, hace años, habían puesto una empresa que hacía respiradores de alta calidad, pero hacía 40 respiradores, al mes, y tuvimos que ponerle todo el apoyo del Estado y ellos hicieron, con sus trabajadores todo el esfuerzo necesario y de repente empezamos a tener 400 respiradores, por mes, y pudimos llenar la Argentina de respiradores y pudimos mandarle respiradores a países vecinos, que estaban asombrados porque, en la Argentina, se construían respiradores. Nosotros cuando empezó aquella pandemia, nos cambió toda la agenda, como al mundo entero, no a nosotros solo, con la diferencia que el mundo entero, no tuvo que encontrar la pandemia, después de Macri y yo sí, con esa diferencia, pero aún así nosotros nunca nos apichonamos, fuimos pusimos el cuerpo, pusimos nuestro esfuerzo, frente a lo desconocido, porque una pandemia es eso, es luchar contra un enemigo invisible que nunca sabes bien por dónde ataca y nunca sabes hasta dónde llega la ferocidad de cada ataque, pero lo sobrellevamos y logramos contenerlo. Y logramos – como repito siempre – que ningún argentino se haya quedado sin atención, en la salud. Y además, volvimos a poner en marcha la economía y ya – en el último trimestre, del año que culminó – empezamos a notar una recuperación cierta, una recuperación clara. Yo vengo de Alderete, allí en Alderete fuimos a una fábrica textil, cuyos dueños me habían mostrado, en el mes de marzo, del año pasado, una empresa, que tienen en una fábrica semejante a la que vi hoy, que tienen en La Rioja, que estaba totalmente paralizada y yo fui a anunciar que le iban a poner en marcha y tenía 16 empleados ese centro productivo, la verdad era casi una fábrica fantasma y fui con toda la intención de que eso empiece a moverse. Bueno, ahora vengo de ver la fábrica que ellos tiene acá, en Alderete, es una fábrica que hoy produce un 50 por ciento más de lo que producía, en octubre, pero en octubre ya producía un 35 por ciento más, que lo que lo producía, en diciembre de 2019 y la verdad es que ya no era una empresa fantasma, sino una donde todas las líneas de producción estaban funcionando y donde no había una docena de empleados, sino que estaba repleto de empleados, trabajadores y trabajadoras. Y la verdad es que lo que uno ve ahí, es un poco lo que se repite en todas las actividades industriales argentinas, un crecimiento muy vigoroso, muy fuerte, muy rápido, que además nos expone a un segundo dilema y se los plantee a ellos que vienen de un sector, que históricamente siempre caímos en el mismo debate, que es sector textil. Este sector es muy importante en la Argentina, porque no solamente ha desarrollado un grado de nivel tecnológico muy alto y de calidad en sus textiles, sino que da mucho trabajo, pues precisa de mucha mano de obra; entendiendo por sector textil la hilandería, el tejido, el teñido de los tejidos y la confección, tiene mucha mano de obra que ocupa. Y yo les marcaba que a mí me encanta verlos crecer, pero me preocupa que los precios de los productos textiles crezcan como crecen, porque es un problema que históricamente repetimos: crece la producción, crece la demanda y aumentan los precios. Y enseguida viene la salida mágica de los que todo lo saben, hasta que les toca gobernar. Ellos dicen: “si suben los precios de los textiles lo que tenemos que hacer es abrir la importación de textiles y cuando abrimos la importación de textiles lo único que hacemos es mandar a la muerte a todas estas empresas. Entonces, yo le decía: “tenemos que terminar con este dilema”, hay que producir más y hay que cuidar a la gente, hay que cuidar al consumidor argentino, las dos cosas hay que hacer. Cuento la experiencia que acabo de vivir, de la industria textil, porque es aplicable a muchos otros sectores, también a los alimentos y en los alimentos el problema es mucho más serio aún, es mucho aún. Porque cuando uno dice que tenemos que cuidar el precio de los alimentos, que consumen los argentinos, la harina, el pan, la carne, la leche, los pollos, los cerdos, los huevos, uno de lo que está hablando es de cuidar el bolsillo de la gente. Es que esto que todos celebramos que ocurra, que la Argentina crezca, que los precios internacionales mejoren, que la Argentina exporte, que todo esto que es glorioso y venturoso no se nos vuelva en contra. Y me pregunto por qué cíclicamente la Argentina debate lo mismo, digo cuando va a ser el momento en que hayamos aprendido que no podemos repetir una y otra vez la misma experiencia. ¿Cuándo va a ser, dónde vamos a terminar? ¿No nos alcanza enfrentar una pandemia que se lleva la vida de la gente, para entender que no podemos seguir con la misma lógica de siempre y que algo debemos cambiar, no nos alcanza? ¿Qué más nos hace falta para entender que hay cosas, que no pueden seguir ocurriendo. Y es por eso creo que esto, alguien me decía, el otro día: “llenás tus discursos de demandas morales”. Sí, lleno mis discursos de demandas morales, porque la política es altamente moral, es altamente ética y apelo a la moral y a la ética, de todos los argentinos para que entiendan que no podemos caer – por enésima vez – en el mismo problema, que siempre nos ha complicado, no podemos. Por eso cuando digo, miren, yo tengo que cuidar, como decía en campaña Daniel cuando era candidato a presidente, tengo que cuidar la mesa de los argentinos, tengo que cuidar que todo esto, que es muy importante para Argentina, que el precio del maíz crezca como creció, que crezca el precio de la carne como crece, porque China ahora importa carne de cualquier tipo, ya no solamente envasada, importa carne con hueso; que el trigo suba, bienvenido sea; que la soja suba, bienvenida sea, la soja preocupa menos porque consumimos menos de soja, solo el cinco por ciento de la producción de soja es la que consumimos en la Argentina, pero en el maíz, en el trigo, en la carne, por favor, ahí tenemos que garantizar que estos precios internacionales, que nos alegra que crezcan y que nos favorece que exporten, no se vuelvan en desmedro de los argentinos. Y la verdad es que uno no quiere ejercer la espada del poder, lo que uno quiere creer es que vive en una sociedad que es capaz de contemplar la experiencia y capaz de entender que no puede tropezarse una y otra vez con la misma piedra, no puede, no puede ser; no puede ser que sea esta la misma discusión que yo tuve años atrás, y que antes que yo la tuvieron otros, no puede ser. Y en esta tarea tenemos que unir los esfuerzos, los que producen, los que trabajan y el Estado, y darnos cuenta que tenemos una sola tarea, que es la tarea central de la política, que es hacer más tranquila la vida de los ciudadanos, ese es el sentido central de la política, que la gente pueda prever su futuro y vivir tranquila, de eso se trata.
Cuando yo planteo estas cosas no estoy peleándome con nadie, no me estoy peleando ni con los textiles, no me estoy peleando con los que producen trigo, ni me estoy peleando con los que producen maíz, ni me peleo con las aceiteras, ni me peleo con los ganaderos, lo que estoy diciendo es la verdad, y lo que estoy expresando es mi preocupación por la gente que está en una situación más delicada, y yo quiero creer que vivo en una sociedad que le presta atención a los que están mal, y quieren ayudar a que los que están mal no padezcan más, pues ayudemos entonces, pues ayudemos entonces. Digo todo esto en el norte del país, que es a mi juicio la región históricamente abandonada por la Argentina, una y otra vez abandonada por la Argentina, y que de una vez por todas nosotros tenemos que integrarla a la Argentina. Integrar a la Argentina no es que yo venga y dé un discurso, es que la volvamos una región interesante para desarrollarse, producir, dar trabajo y crecer, eso es integrarla, y para lograr ese objetivo tenemos que hacer lo que hicimos días atrás con los gobernadores del norte grande, donde Juan estuvo presente, y ampliar esa discusión a la Unión Industrial del norte grande, a los trabajadores del norte, y ver cómo empezamos a resolver los problemas del norte grande. Acá tenemos que entender que producir es parte de asimetría muy grande y complica mucho la vida de los que producen, ya por lo pronto tienen que hacer, al que mejor le va, mil kilómetros para llevar al puerto lo que producen, o para llevar a los grandes centros urbanos del país. Tenemos que entender que algo debemos hacer para que esas asimetrías desaparezcan, que el Estado tiene que hacer una parte importante, también tienen que hacer una parte importante los empresarios, y que tenemos que dar trabajo a los que están en el norte, que tenemos que terminar con esta Argentina donde los que están en el norte sueñan con irse a Córdoba, a Buenos Aires o a Rosario, pensando que allí van a encontrar un mejor futuro, y al í lo único que encuentran, en la mayoría de los casos, es hacinamiento y olvido. De eso se trata este debate, de eso se trata. El 25 de febrero, se me complicaron un poco las fechas a mí porque tengo que viajar a México, pero voy a tratar de estar, pero el 25 de febrero, que es la próxima reunión del norte grande, nosotros de esa reunión primera que hicimos en Chilecito, en La Rioja, nosotros nos llevamos unos serie de deberes, y a esos deberes vamos a empezar a dar respuesta en esa próxima reunión, y nos llevamos todas las preocupaciones, las preocupaciones que la Unión Industrial del norte siempre me ha plantado con el 814, el Decreto que tanto les sirvió para mejorar la competitividad, todos los deberes nos los llevamos y estamos viendo cómo resolverlos y darles una repuesta a todo eso.
El norte no tiene que preocuparse por qué va a pasar con el biodiesel, o qué va a pasar con el bioetanol, porque allí ha habido una inversión muy grande y lo que hay que hacer es preservar esa inversión Lo que sí hay que hacer es hacer que las cosas funcionen, porque tal como están no están funcionando, pero que las cosas funcionen no quiere decir que se deje de producir, eso creen otros, para nosotros que las cosas funcionen es que se produzca, se venda y se crezca, y por lo tanto cuando decimos revisemos lo que está funcionando, no es para achicar, no es para dejar de producir, no es para dejar de dar trabajo, es para producir más, para que esa producción sirva más a la Argentina y para que el trabajo se sostenga y crezca, es para eso, no es para otra cosa. Nosotros no somos los que creemos que la mejor Argentina es la Argentina que excluye, nosotros creemos que la mejor Argentina es la Argentina que ampara. Nosotros no somos los que creemos que la Argentina que mejor funciona es la Argentina que ajusta, la Argentina que mejor funciona es la Argentina que contiene a todos, y a todos les da un lugar en la sociedad donde desarrollarse y crecer. Esa es la Argentina que uno quiere. Y en esa Argentina, vuelvo a repetir, como dije al comienzo, el norte es un norte prioritario, porque las políticas sucesivas que se han dado a lo largo del tiempo, y fundamentalmente estos últimos cuatro años, lo que hicieron fue dejar al norte en un estado de abandono absoluto, absoluto, y como suelo decir que no soy amigo de eso que el Papa llama la teoría del descarte, porque yo no creo que a la Argentina le sobren argentinos, lo que creo que le falta a la Argentina son ideas, voluntad y ética de muchos para poner en marcha una Argentina más justa, una Argentina socialmente más justa. Y como sé que eso finalmente en la inmensa mayoría de los argentinos anida, porque yo no creo que los argentinos seamos una sociedad perversa que lo que busca es una sociedad desigual, donde algunos ganen muchos y millones pierdan tanto, lo que creo que debemos h hacer es sentarnos seriamente a ver cómo construimos eso y cómo lo construimos a través del diálogo, y prestarle menos atención a los profetas del odio, que cuando uno dice quiero preservar la mesa de los argentinos, ellos leen promueven una nueva pelea con el campo; y cuando uno dice queremos revisar la Ley de Biocombustibles, ellos leen quieren terminar con los biocombustibles. Cuando nosotros decimos queremos revisar, es que queremos hacerlo mejor, y cuando decimos queremos hacerlo mejor, queremos que ustedes produzcan más y den más trabajo, eso quiere decir. Así que lo que nos queda por delante es todo una tarea de debate, de discutir, a mí no me asusta el debate, me asustan las mentiras, no el debate, me asusta que impregnen mentiras en los argentinos, yo no sé cómo pasó, pero hasta hace veinte días atrás yo era un envenenador serial, había comprado unas vacunas para envenenar a la gente, y ahora resulta que no sé cómo pasó, pero me piden por favor que consiga veneno para todos los argentinos, no sé cómo pasó, es el país que nos tocó en suerte, igual yo creo que en este país somos muchos más la gente honesta, la gente ética, la gente decente, la gente de bien, la gente que quiere vivir en un país más igualitario, somos muchos más, vamos a ganarles a los otros. Gracias por estar acá y mucha fuerza, gracias a todos y todas.
topics_EN: Words of the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández during his meeting with representatives of the industrial unions of the NEA and the NOA and union leaders, in San Javier, province of Tucumán.
speeches_EN:
Very good, thank you very much to all, thanks Juan for your words, it is always nice to return to Tucumán, very beautiful, although the clouds do not let us see the beauty of the place, but one presumes it and very happy to be here, at a singular moment, of Argentina. As Juan well said everything that had to happen, everything we had to face when we, in March, there with Matías, with Martín we saw the first data that the economy began to work and we were already very encouraged with the idea that we were lightening the economy - as I said in the campaign - the pandemic and the pandemic fell not that we affected us alone, turned the world, changed the whole reality of the world. And suddenly, another urgency appeared, in such a painful scenario, as the economic scenario we had received, the painful scenario - in this case - was the Argentine health system, which had been absolutely abandoned, for which they ruled before us, which had even eliminated the Ministry of Health, which had allowed vaccines, in the galpons of the customs. We gave a plan preserving the health of the Argentines. Now how can the health of Argentines be preserved in a pandemic? In the way we did: guaranteeing that no Argentine is left without health; Then we knew that we faced a virus, that when it affected adults, the elderly, it became lethal and it was very difficult to avoid it and today when we looked at the results we realize that this was a certain fact, because the average age of those who have died from this virus is 74 years. And we are dedicated to taking care of everything we could and warned of the complexity, difficulty and risk that they ran in the pandemic, but the biggest concern we had is that we did not happen what we had seen happened, in Europe and in many Latin American countries, which citizens arrived in search of medical care, hospitals and hospitals had where to receive them. And in record time we had to start and we had to build hospitals, which had been half doing. Then, we launched a number of modular hospitals, which we built at incredible speed, in different parts of the country and thus we achieved that 3,600 beds, intensive therapy unit to be incorporated into the health system, and thus we achieve that no Argentine, which has become ill by Coronavirus, has gone to a hospital and the hospital said: "I do not have how to attend to him." And that gives us great peace of mind. We also discovered - suddenly - that there was an essential device to serve us, in this situation, which is called automatic respirator, and that the world did not have and discovered, that - in Argentina - two Cordoba brothers: an engineer and a doctor, years ago, had put a company that made high quality respirators, but made 40 respirators, a month, and we had to put all the support of the state and they made, with their workers all the effort we needed. Respirators, per month, and we could fill Argentina with respirators and we were able to send respirators to neighboring countries, which were amazed because, in Argentina, respirators were built. When that pandemic began, the entire agenda changed us, as to the whole world, not us alone, with the difference that the whole world did not have to find the pandemic, after Macri and I did, with that difference, but still we never apichon, we went on the body, we put our effort, in front of the unknown Ferocity of each attack, but we cope with it and manage to contain it. And we achieve - as I always repeat - that no Argentine has run out of attention, in health. And in addition, we launched the economy again and already - in the last quarter, of the year that culminated - we began to notice a certain recovery, a clear recovery. I come from Alderete, there in Alderete we went to a textile factory, whose owners had shown me, in March, last year, a company, which they have in a factory similar to what I saw today, that they have in La Rioja, that I was totally paralyzed and I went to announce that they were going to start and had 16 employees that productive center, the truth was almost a ghost factory move Well, now I come from seeing the factory that they have here, in Alderete, it is a factory that today produces 50 percent more than what it produced, in October, but in October it already produced 35 percent more, than what produced it, in December 2019 and the truth is that it was no longer a ghost company, but one where all the production lines were working and where there were no dozen employees, but it was full of employees, workers. And the truth is that what one sees there, is a bit that is repeated in all Argentine industrial activities, a very vigorous, very strong, very fast growth, which also exposes us to a second dilemma and considers them that come from a sector, which historically always fall in the same debate, which is textile sector. This sector is very important in Argentina, because it has not only developed a very high and quality technological level degree in its textiles, but also gives a lot of work, because it requires a lot of labor; Understanding by textile sector the spinning, the fabric, the dye of the fabrics and the preparation, it has a lot of labor it occupies. And I marked that I love to see them grow, but I am concerned that the prices of textile products grow as they grow, because it is a problem that we historically repeat: production grows, demand grows and prices increase. And immediately comes the magical exit of those who know everything, until they have to govern them. They say: “If the prices of textiles raise what we have to do is open the import of textiles and when we open the import of textiles, all we do is send all these companies to death. So, I said: "We have to end this dilemma," you have to produce more and you have to take care of people, you have to take care of the Argentine consumer, the two things must be done. I count the experience that I just lived, of the textile industry, because it is applicable to many other sectors, also to food and food the problem is much more serious, it is still much. Because when one says that we have to take care of the price of food, which the Argentines, the flour, the bread, the meat, the milk, the pigs, the eggs, the eggs, one of what is speaking is to take care of the pocket of the people. It is that this we all celebrate that Argentina grows, that international prices improve, that Argentina export, that all this is glorious and windy does not become against us. And I wonder why Argentina debates the same, I say when it will be the time we have learned that we cannot repeat the same experience again and again. When will it be, where are we going to end? Is it not enough for us to face a pandemic that leads people's lives, to understand that we cannot continue with the same logic of always and that something should change, it does not reach us? What else do we need to understand that there are things, which cannot continue to happen. And that's why I think this, someone told me, the other day: "You fill your speeches of moral demands." Yes, full my speeches of moral demands, because politics is highly moral, it is highly ethical and appeal to morality and ethics, of all Argentines so that they understand that we cannot fall - for the umpteenth time - in the same problem, which has always complicated us, we cannot. That is why when I say, look, I have to take care of, as Daniel said when I was a candidate for president, I have to take care of the table of Argentines, I have to take care that all this, which is very important for Argentina, that the price of corn grows as it grew, that the price of the meat grows as it grows, because China now imports meat of any kind, not only packaged, it imports meat with bone; May the wheat rise, welcome; That soybeans rises, welcome, soybeans worry less because we consume less soybeans, only five percent of soybean production is what we consume in Argentina, but in corn, in wheat, in the flesh, please, there we have to ensure that these international prices, which make us grow and that they favor us to export, do not return to the excess of the Argentines. And the truth is that one does not want to exercise the sword of power, what one wants to believe is that he lives in a society that is able to contemplate the experience and capable of understanding that he cannot stumble over and over again with the same stone, he cannot, he cannot be; It cannot be that this is the same discussion that I had years ago, and that before I had others, it cannot be. And in this task we have to unite the efforts, those who produce, those who work and the State, and realize that we have a single task, which is the central task of politics, which is to make citizens the life of citizens, that is the central sense of politics, that people can foresee their future and live quietly, that's what it is.
When I raise these things I am not fighting with anyone, I am not fighting with the textiles, I am not fighting with those who produce wheat, nor am I fighting with those who produce corn, nor do I fight with the oils, nor do I fight with the farmers, what I am telling is the truth, and what I am expressing is my concern for the people who are in a more delicate situation, and Those who are wrong, and want to help those who are wrong do not suffer anymore, because let's help then, let's help then. I say all this in the north of the country, which is in my opinion the region historically abandoned by Argentina, again and again abandoned by Argentina, and that once and for all of us we have to integrate it into Argentina. Integrating Argentina is not that I come and give a speech, it is that we return an interesting region to develop, produce, give work and grow, that is to integrate it, and to achieve that goal we have to do what we did days ago with the governors of the North Grande, where Juan was present, and expand that discussion to the industrial union of the North Grande, to the workers of the North, and see how we began to solve the problems of the northern north. Here we have to understand that producing is part of very large asymmetry and complicates the lives of those they produce, for now they have to do, which best goes, a thousand kilometers to take to the port what they produce, or to take to the large urban centers of the country. We have to understand that something we must do so that these asymmetries disappear, that the State has to make an important part, the entrepreneurs also have to make an important part, and that we have to give work to those who are in the north, that we have to end this Argentina where those who are in the north dream of going to Córdoba, Buenos Aires or Rosario, thinking that there they will find a better future, and the only thing they find, in most cases, in most cases, in most cases. That's what this debate is about, that's what it is about. On February 25, I was a little complicated by the dates to me because I have to travel to Mexico, but I will try to be, but on February 25, which is the next meeting of the North Grande, we of that first meeting we did in Chilecito, in La Rioja, we take some series of duties, and to those duties we will start responding in that next meeting, and we take all the concerns, the concerns that the industrial union of the north has always planted with 814 that so much served to improve competitiveness, all duties take them and we are seeing how to solve them and give them a response to all that.
The north does not have to worry why it will happen to biodiesel, or what will happen to bioethanol, because there has been a very large investment and what you have to do is preserve that investment what you have to do is make things work, because as they are not working, but that things work does not mean that they stop producing, that believes others, for us that things work, Therefore, when we say we review what is working, it is not to shrink, it is not to stop producing, it is not to stop giving work, it is to produce more, so that this production serves Argentina more and so that the work is sustained and grows, it is for that, it is not for something else. We are not the ones who believe that the best Argentina is the Argentine that excludes, we believe that the best Argentina is the Argentine that covers. We are not the ones who believe that Argentina that works best is the Argentine that adjusts, the Argentine that works best is the Argentina that contains everyone, and everyone gives them a place in society where to develop and grow. That is the Argentina that one wants. And in that Argentina, I repeat again, as I said at the beginning, the north is a priority north, because the successive policies that have occurred over time, and fundamentally these last four years, what they did was to leave the north in a state of absolute, absolute abandonment, and as I usually say that I am not a friend of what the Pope calls the theory of discard, because I do not believe that Argentina A more just Argentina, a socially more fair Argentina. And since I know that finally in the vast majority of Argentines Anida, because I do not believe that we Argentines are a perverse society that what you are looking for is an unequal society, where some win many and millions lose so much, what I think we must have to do is seriously sit to see how we build that and how we build it through dialogue, and pay less attention to the prophets of hatred Read with the field; And when one says we want to review the biofuel law, they read they want to end the biofuels. When we say we want to review, we want to do better, and when we say we want to do better, we want you to produce more and give more work, that means. So what we have ahead is a task of debate, to discuss, I do not scare the debate, I am scared of lies, not the debate, it scares me that they permeate lies in the Argentines, I do not know how it happened, but until twenty days ago I was a serial poisoner, I had bought some vaccines to poison the people, and now it turns out that I do not know how I The Argentines, I do not know how it happened, it is the country that touched us in luck, the same I believe that in this country we are many more honest people, ethical people, decent people, good people, people who want to live in a more equal country, we are many more, we will beat others. Thank you for being here and a lot of strength, thanks to all.

topics_ES: Palabras del Presidente de la Nación, Alberto Fernández, por el Foro Económico Mundial de Davos, desde la Residencia Presidencial de Olivos
speeches_ES:
Les agradezco la oportunidad de estar frente a este Foro de tanto impacto, que nos convoca a la reflexión a la acción para construir un mundo diferente. La pandemia que vivimos no es un mero accidente de la historia, es un llamado de atención para edificar una casa común con otros cimientos, o despertamos mejores, o sucumbimos peores. No hay otra opción para el día después de esta calamidad. Vivimos un tiempo en el que se ponen a prueba todos los paradigmas, estoy seguro que el imperativo moral que se impone en esta hora es poner nuestra prioridad en los últimos, en los descartados en los invisibilizados, en los más vulnerables. La fraternidad debe ser el nuevo nombre del desarrollo y la solidaridad el nuevo nombre de la paz social, son valores que no resultan exclusivos de un sector, deben comprometer a los estados y a las empresas, a los que trabajan y al capital. Esto no es una teoría, es una convicción que hemos llevado adelante en Argentina en estos meses de gestión. Por ejemplo, el programa de Asistencia de Emergencia al Trabajo y a la Producción asistió en la pandemia 60 por ciento de los empleadores del país. En ese mismo tiempo, lanzamos una línea de crédito garantizada por el Estado a tasa 0 para trabajadores independientes, y además otorgamos créditos subsidiados para 110 mil pymes, por un total que representa el 2 por ciento del PBI argentino. El Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia aseguró las condiciones de vida de los sectores más afectados, apuntalando al mismo tiempo la demanda. Desde el inicio comenzamos negociaciones cuando con diversos laboratorios en pos de la adquisición de vacunas, para proteger a las argentinas y argentinos del COVID-19. La pandemia nos demostró, una vez más, que para lidiar con los grandes desafíos globales debemos cooperar entre actores públicos y privados, y que la vacuna debe ser considerada un bien público global. Esta cooperación pública privada posibilitó que la industria argentina intervenga, en un esquema de integración productiva junto a México, en la producción de la vacuna Oxford-AstraZeneca para toda Latinoamérica. Esto nos permitirá impulsar una campaña de vacunación que preserva primero a los sectores más expuestos al riesgo de la pandemia. Las medidas adoptadas han sido fundamentales para iniciar una recuperación, que está siendo más veloz de lo que pensábamos hace apenas unos meses. La opción no es la vida o la economía, sino la vida con más y mejor economía. Nuestro sector industrial viene teniendo una recuperación notable. En noviembre pasado, la economía había alcanzado el 87 por ciento de la producción perdida por la pandemia. En la industria ya registramos 4.500 puestos de trabajo que antes de la pandemia no existían. Llevamos cinco meses seguidos de recuperación del empleo industrial. En plena pandemia tuvimos que lidiar con otro virus, no menos destructivo, el endeudamiento tóxico e irresponsable. Con el acuerdo político y social de todo el país, alcanzamos una reestructuración de la deuda con acreedores privados con un nivel de aceptación superior 99 por ciento. Así despejamos el camino para empezar a construir un futuro con producción y trabajo. El diálogo con el Fondo Monetario Internacional está en marcha y ha sido hasta aquí muy constructivo, hemos recibido innumerables muestras de apoyo tanto de la comunidad internacional como de los miembros del G-20. La renegociación de las condiciones del acuerdo con el Fondo Monetario Internacional incorporará nuevas perspectivas macroeconómicas y un entendimiento común de las necesidades específicas de la economía local. No hay más lugar para ajustes irresponsables, imposibles de cumplir, que perjudican la credibilidad tanto de nosotros como dirigentes, como de quienes otorgan asistencias irreales. El programa que se acuerde con el Fondo será enviado al Congreso nacional para involucrar a toda la dirigencia política argentina en un camino de desarrollo, que tenga la sustentabilidad de la deuda, la inclusión social y la transparencia como políticas de Estado. Un hecho histórico para el país, sin dudas. No es el tiempo del conformismo sino de la transición, de la transformación. Nosotros observamos los desafíos que se suscitan de la crisis actual como un punto de inflexión, para avanzar en el gran reinicio que tanto pregona Klaus Schwab. En este escenario es necesario vincular el multilateralismo con un concepto de multisolidaridad, que involucre a estados, empresas y también a trabajadores.
