No nos dejemos llevar solamente por los números, pensemos de qué se trata esto en serio, porque hemos estado el otro día Julio., un paciente, que se recuperó gracias al plasma, él me dijo, lo voy a contar porque me impactó mucho, que vio esa luz que algunos reflejan cuando estuvieron al borde de la muerte, pero no estaba en esas condiciones, tres semanas en respirador, tres semanas con su vida sostenida gracias a medios médicos. Y le atribuimos al plasma., que no se puede usar en todos los casos, es un tratamiento específico para algunos casos. Lo mismo José. Y los dos me decían que no sabían cómo se habían contagiado, decían “pero si en mi casa salíamos solo al supermercado”. Así que no es menor ni es un tema sencillo, estamos delante de la pandemia más grande y la crisis económica producida por una pandemia más grande de la historia reciente, seguro, cien años atrás hay que ir para encontrar algo parecido en términos de epidemia.
¿Dónde está la esperanza entonces? La esperanza creo yo está en la vacuna, en los remedios, y se ha trabajado contra reloj, y lo hemos podido hacer en la Argentina porque creemos en la ciencia y porque, lo tengo que decir, este Gobierno, el Gobierno Nacional y el de la Provincia de Buenos Aires todo a puesto en nuestros científicos, y hoy probando vacunas, algunas dicen que se pueden conseguir pronto, esperamos eso, esa va a ser la respuesta definitiva. No se puede tratar esto de esperar que naturalmente afloje o que pare, porque no ha pasado en ningún lado. Mientras tanto tampoco se trata de enojarnos entre nosotros, obviamente, esto es largo, el cansancio, el hastío, la ansiedad, la angustia traen descuidos, y no quiero hablar de aquellos que tienen esa posición i irresponsable de desafiar a la enfermedad y a los demás y contagiarse y contagiar, hablo de los que se relajan o aflojan. Se pueden cometer descuidos, pero sepan bien que si los números no bajan, v a haber que ir a una cuarentena mucho más dura, porque si no las camas se van llenando no podemos permitir que nadie se quede sin la atención que se merece como un derecho.
Hoy no podemos elegir si tener o no la pandemia, lo que sí podemos elegir es si la dejamos trabajar sola, si la dejamos hacer o si como sociedad y Estado vamos a hacer algo contra la pandemia, y así es como venimos haciendo en la Argentina y en la provincia de Buenos Aires, protegernos y trabajar colectivamente, falta menos, no bajemos los brazos ahora, por favor, sigamos cuidándonos. Gracias.
PRESIDENTE.- Muchas gracias Horacio, muchas gracias Axel, unas últimas palabras. Primero les recuerdo que vamos a extender esto hasta el día 19 de agosto; segundo, como bien dijo Axel, nosotros seguimos trabajando fuertemente para ver si la ciencia nos alcanza el remedio que nos permita curar a aquellos que se enferman. Vamos a mantener el ATP y vamos a mantener el IFE para todos los que lo necesitan, nadie piense que el Estado los va abandonar y se va olvidar de ustedes en este momento, y como recién hablábamos con Horacio, vamos a hacer más frecuentes en la semana nuestros encuentros para hacer un monitoreo más cercano.
Déjenme terminar con una reflexión: este encuentro que tuvimos hoy con Horacio y con Axel duró 61 minutos, si tomamos en cuenta los datos de ayer, en este ratito se contagiaron 268 argentinos. Y si tomamos en cuenta los muertos de ayer, en este ratito se murieron cuatro argentinos. Eso es el coronavirus, no nos descuidemos, el problema no lo superamos. Les pido a todos la máxima responsabilidad. En el día de hoy va a estar firmado el Decreto de Necesidad y Urgencia que dispone las nuevas reglas sanitarias, les aviso que allí estarán prohibidos los encuentros sociales, y quienes los lleven adelante sepan que pueden incurrir en la responsabilidad penal de estar transmitiendo una enfermedad.
Les damos las gracias a todos y a todas, con toda responsabilidad empecemos esta etapa que se inicia. Muchísimas gracias a todas y a todos.
topics_EN: Announcement of the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández; of the Head of Government of the City of Buenos Aires, Horacio Rodríguez Larreta and the governor of the province of Buenos Aires, Axel Kicillof
speeches_EN:
We know that, in the Latin American continent, fundamentally, in America in general, it is this moment the epicenter of the virus and we know that, in our country, in our beloved Argentina, we are going through a growing moment of circulation of the virus, which we all have the impression that it focuses on the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, and that is largely true, because there more than 90 percent of the cases are occurring. But that is as true that the problem has begun to radiate other places, radiates south of Santa Fe, radiates Entre Ríos, radiates Córdoba. We are also seeing that they have begun to demonstrate spotlights in other parts of the interior of the country, we talked the last time we saw each other from provinces such as Jujuy, from provinces such as Chaco, from Province as Río Negro. Today, other places are added to the problem and then we have to get the attention of what is happening to us because we are, as I told them at the beginning, we are facing an invisible enemy and the truth is that the world has not found the weapons to fight them. To this day he has not found a vaccine, nor has he found the medication that allows the disease to be cope with. And therefore, beyond what many think, anyone who gets sick, suffers, the asymptomatic has to suffer from quarantine days, and the one with symptoms and ends hospitalized, believe me that the experiences that one listens are not easy, it is not another disease, it is not one more flu. And the one who needs care, everything indicates that he needs about 25 days to get out of intensive therapy. We are not facing one more flu, we have a disease that we do not know how to prevent it and we do not know how to cure it. And the only solution we find, as I always tell them, is to take care of us. As I have repeated, following a teaching of Dr. Cahn, in truth the virus does not look for us, we are going to look for it. And that is the biggest problem that we have today, our circulation, the circulation has become the greatest enemy, to overcome this pandemic situation, because we feel that the problem is noted, and when we feel that the problem is noted, we relax, and when we relax is when we expose ourselves to the worst risk. And it is clear that we relax because we have been taking care of in our homes for many days, and I am clear that all that generates stress, generates anger, generates discouragement, and also the concern, the concern generated by the uncertainty to which the pandemic condemns us. No one in the world knows when this will end. Check what happens in Europe, in other parts of the world. What is happening is that in those places, what they are fearing is a second wave of the virus, and when everything seems overcome the problem begins again. And we have no more solution, I can't recommend another solution to take care of yourself. And that is why we are here with the Head of Government of the City of Buenos Aires, together with the governor of the province of Buenos Aires, this is the epicenter of the problem to tell them how we are going to continue. Until August 16 we will keep things how they are today, but I tell them in recent days it shows that the virus is circulating more and a greater amount of infections are detected, and all this occurs consequently generates internations and unfortunately deaths. Every time I speak of deaths, I dedicate them a memory at this time and I affection for those who have lost loved ones at this time. Now, what is happening to us? It is happening to us that as we are looking at numbers and numbers, we begin to normalize the numbers, and we are neglecting that behind each number there is a life, there is a person who has become ill, or there is a person who has left. Each number has a name and surname, each number has a face, and therefore I want to call them to reflection because it is much more than a number to what I am summoning them, I am not calling it to correct a statistic, I am summoning them to take care of our lives and take care of the life of others, I am summoning them not to infect and not infect, and I am summoning them, once again, once again, we do. I know that for many it is complex all this time that has happened, but I also know that no one brings me a better solution, that we are not discussing how free we are, or how prisoners we remain from the pandemic, we are discussing the only way we have to combat this problem. Let's look a little on our plates, films, as some have called them, let's see a little what has happened in these last fifteen days, and let's follow the same logic that we always follow, also to have encouragement that everything we have done is not that it makes no sense, we have done a lot. And if thank God, we are still discussing what we are discussing, we are discussing it for all the effort and all the work we did. If in the province of Buenos Aires we would not have doubled the amount of therapy beds, today the province of Buenos Aires would be absolutely exploded, without being able to give health response to its inhabitants, because they also have many people from the city of Buenos Aires, many grandparents, many affiliates of the PAMI, who are being served today in the province of Buenos Aires. So, I ask you to go to the first plate, I have control, forgiveness, to the first plaque. Here we have how we have evolved and how we are today in relation to other countries of the continent, in relation to the number of people every one hundred thousand inhabitants that have been infected. As we can see, we are still well, as we see we are in some extent, dominating the situation. If we look like the mortality rate, this means how many people have died for every million inhabitants, we are still in a privilege situation. This is possible because the health system is worked, because the health system responds and because Argentina has definitely prepared to face this time. Now, let me approach the screen because I want to show you some things that are already more moving curves. This is the incidence rate, the number of people who spread every one hundred thousand inhabitants. Here they have the growth of all countries, Chile, Peru, Brazil, Bolivia. This is Argentina, Argentina is still containing the amount of contagion, but Argentina is increasing the amount of infections, and that is in the opinion of all those that I have consulted, the result that there has been some relaxation, there has been more circulation, and the virus has circulated more, and the infection have increased more. The mortality rate is happening to us a bit, if they upload the infections it is reasonable to think that the mortality rate also grows. If the mortality rate does not grow at the same speed of infections, it is because precisely the health system is responding. And the health system is responding for two reasons: for the initial quarantine time we made and because we took advantage of that time to provide all places in the country, especially the city of Buenos Aires and the province of Buenos Aires, of beds to be able to serve all those people. Remember when we argued if we were going to have chins, if we were going to have respirators, today is not missing, and the one who needs it has it. If you look, notice how the country today is much more colored than the last time we speak, and look like the south of Santa Fe, like East Córdoba, as the Paraná area, begins to do in some way affected by the irradiation of Buenos Aires, how is all this explained? But we can see this in several places, we can see it clearly in Mendoza, we can see it clearly in Córdoba, how do you explain this? Well, this is the conformation of the country we gave ourselves, a country that concentrates a lot in the port of Buenos Aires and then the whole country comes in search of supplies, products, goods, to the area of ​​the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, and take what they wanted to buy, and with them they take the virus, and thus begin the infections in all these places. Let's review the incidence rate in the different parts of the country, clearly the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires is occupying the first place, the Metropolitan Area of ​​Buenos Aires, Greater Buenos Aires is well below in the incidence rate, remember that here what is calculated is how much infected we have every one hundred thousand inhabitants. I want to give my co -ported fact, I am a Buenos Aires, look if one takes the amount of infected that the city of Buenos Aires has had, there have been about five infections for each apple of Buenos Aires. Take into account this data to realize how the virus is circulating and to understand how risky it means to circulate today. Take it into account, I did not exactly made that account in Greater Buenos Aires, clearly and differently, the number Buenos Aires has many more people and must have many more apples, but I made this number in my city, I made this calculation in my city, and it is not a minor fact, it is a fact so that we all understand. The city head of government makes enormous effort for the city to recover its usual activity, but that effort forces us to have a lot of responsibility, and return to the usual activity, as I always say, it is not the habituality we met, it is not that habituality, it is another, it is a habituality that forces us to permanently preserve the risk of being able to infect ourselves. If one looks at the mortality rate, obviously the city of Buenos Aires, which is the most contagious, is the one with the highest mortality rate, obviously. And then they follow the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, Greater Buenos Aires, Chaco, the rest of the province of Buenos Aires, Río Negro. This is the country's average, 76 dead per million inhabitants. Now I am going to show you how the infections have evolved in many provinces, this blue line that I do not know if it comes to see, which is the highest, it is the Chaco, this red line is Río Negro. But let me stop in this yellow line that is Córdoba, look at how Córdoba has risen, the Pico de Contagios de Córdoba. Let me show you Jujuy, that we speak last time with the governor of Jujuy, look Jujuy what happened. Then we have Santa Fe that also shows growth. I believe that it has to do clearly with that irradiation of the infection that we take from the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, towards that south of Santa Fe. Miren Mendoza. I want to attract attention to everyone, because beyond getting angry and questioning me, because I think that the only thing that preserves us is to take care of us at home, I am only telling you the truth. I really have to tell them this because I would like Argentina to work in full normality and we can all go to work, we can enjoy that the shows work, that the restaurants work, but this is what is happening to us, and this is the product of our circulation. I want to show you how things change, according to at all times, and I have chosen three provinces, which I just mentioned. Look, this is what we call mandatory isolation. Notice week per week how many cases were and notice when social distancing, how the cases grew. We with what we called quarantine could contain cases, and with social distancing, all we do is grow in cases. This is the case of Santa Fe, I left the two jurisdictions that we always speak, which are Buenos Aires and the city, to go to other sides, and so that everyone understands that this problem not only happens here. Look what happens in Córdoba, look at what happened in Córdoba while there was quarantine, and look at what happened when he released. Look what happened in Mendoza while there was quarantine, and look at what happened when it was released. Now, I am sure that in the mood of all the governors he has always eased the desire to trust social responsibility, the care that we all have to have not only of us but of the other, because they remember that asymptomatics can spread without knowing it. I show these data, which are hard data, so that we understand that this of removing the restriction of staying at home, has these costs if we are not responsible. I insist at this point, these are the costs we pay if we are not responsible. If one looks at the number of cases, because with this issue there is also a lot of confusion. I want to explain to all that we are announcing the cases, as we know them. Yesterday, for example, we report more than one hundred cases, but that does not mean that more than one hundred people died yesterday, that means that we learned that there were cases of deaths and when we know them we inform them. The reality is that we today have an average close to the 80 dead cases, this low relativize it because it can also be that there are cases that we still do not know and the information has not yet reached us. What I am clear is that 80 cases per day is a worrying issue, and if one looks at what has happened with lethality, this curve, this is the number of people who have died, infected who have died, one sees a clear decline and a curve that tends to stabilize with a rate of 1.8 more or less lethality. Now let me make a reflection on this point. In May the amount of dead were 375, in June 700 was the number of deceased people, twenty -four days later there were 1,500 and twenty -four days later were 3 thousand. That means that every twenty -four days, so far, we have doubled the amount of deaths. I tell you this because I do not want more people to die, this is not a statistic for me, this is people who lose their lives. And so that this does not happen, what we have to avoid is that we get us, and not to get what we need to do is preserve, take care of ourselves, take care of ourselves. These are hard data and it is very possible that this cost of lethality grows, and I am far from reassuring myself with that data. I still told them at the total country we have 55 percent of occupied bed, and 45 percent of available beds. If one looks in the metropolitan area of ​​Buenos Aires, we are still prepared, the city of Buenos Aires has 68 percent more or less occupied and the GBA 62 percent. This means that we are supporting the health care of the disease in an adequate way, we are doing, without any doubt. But what we have to do is for the growth of infection, and stop the growth of infection if there is no quarantine depends on us, it depends on the responsibility of each of us. I already showed them, there is no other possibility, there is no other way. I ask you that with all this that I have told you, let's work this last part, let's realize that this problem does not depend on a president, a governor, or a head of government, depends on the social decision to join efforts to stop this issue. The big problem we have had in the last fifteen days, is that the truth we all relax, we all feel that the thing was contained, and the situation is not contained, we are still very far from being contained. And I want to talk to those who want young people most, I want to talk to them from the soul, from the heart. We were all young and many of us want to continue keeping the young soul. And we all know that in youth the encounter with friends is very important, it is very important to be close to affections, share, enjoy. I miss the recitals as much as you, strange to return football as much as the greatest football fan, I miss playing the guitar with my friends like nobody but do you know what happens? We cannot do it, we cannot do it, because young people also think they are immune to this disease, and it is true statistics say that they are the ones who best cope with the disease, but young people infect and when they infect an adult, that disease that seems to be more pious with the young man, is imposed with older adults. So guys, girls, chiques, I ask you please make that effort, let's make that effort, it is a sonse to gather at electronic parties, at closed parties, clandestine, hidden. They do not realize the risk to which they are exposed and the risk they run, I ask them please. And I ask the same to each of us, we all miss the encounter with the family on Sundays and we all miss the roast with friends, we all miss playing the mince, but we cannot, we cannot, because each of those meetings is a huge risk to which we submit and to which we submit to the other. That we are really a little tired with all this and worried because we do not see the horizon is reasonable we are in a pandemic, what is happening to them is what reasonably happens to a human being who is living what we are all living. I ask you please help us, I ask you please that the mischief of a party can be a very large headache for many, and I ask them to help us and accompany us, because we need them, today more than ever. With this last reflection, thank them for the time they have given me, I will give the floor to Horacio, so that he speaks to us as we continue in the city. RODRÍGUEZ LARRETA.- Good afternoon to all, thanks Lord President, Mr. Governor, are very difficult times for all and I have no doubt that in front of a pandemic as hard as the one that whips us, in Argentina and in the world, the best thing we can do is work together, as we have been doing from the first day and how we will continue to do so. As in all these conferences I begin with the city's data: the last time - 15 days ago - I had said, here, we were coming three weeks or less, of an average of 1,000 cases per day; Today taking the last two weeks, that average is 1,100 cases per day. It is a level of stabilized cases, but as well showed, just the president, of course it is the highest in the country, since by far, the city of Buenos Aires is the area of ​​greatest density and this virus is spread to proximity. But we have what is called the infection rate or the R that is in 1.03 and we have to make the effort to lower it from 1 and only, that day, the cases will begin to go down; The same measured in another way, gives a duplication time of 34.1 days and the occupation of beds, of intensive care, today is with 10 less occupied beds, which two weeks ago; In percentage terms, it is the 59 percent occupation, which is compatible with the fact that the president only gave, because in the last week, we add 50 more beds. Now the virus is dynamic and we do not have scientific knowledge and that is the big problem we face, that is what gives us uncertainty, what we do have is the experience of other great cities in the world, from which we are learning from their successes and their mistakes. In addition, the city has its peculiarities, with which comparisons always have some nuance. We always try to develop a strategy, based on the data, an intelligent, specific and most pointed health strategy. Today, in the city of Buenos Aires, we can see three different realities: first, that of vulnerable neighborhoods. About two months ago we had a very strong outbreak, which began in neighborhood 31 and then extended to the rest of the popular neighborhoods. We put a lot of presence of the State; We work, as a team, with the entire detecting plan, the National Government; We isolate, especially those of greatest vulnerability, such as older adults; We tried preventively and really the operation worked. Today the contagiosity rate is fine below 1, the cases have fallen dramatic. In that - once again - I highlight the joint work of the Ministry of National Health, with our Ministry of Health. The truth is looking at the numbers, today, it has been a success. Two months ago it was one of the main concerns, which together, we presented in this same room. And I also want to recognize the social organizations of the neighborhoods, in which we supported each other, which gave us a huge hand those organizations, often led by women, the dining rooms, helped us to get home by house with many volunteers. Really to the whole team thank you very much because we managed to control a situation, which seemed very difficult. The second group is those who care for us, who are the ones who have to take care of, who are exposed to the virus and because also, if they are infected, we lose health workers, who are the one who most need today. We every week we test all health and geriatric workers. Today we have already been done with everyone, with 175,000 serological tests of which 1800 positive cases arose that, of course, we isolate them, that if we had not done this they would be in their hospitals, health centers or geriatric centers infecting their classmates or really patients. Today it is giving more or less, 150 positive cases identified per day; The same began, three weeks ago with security forces, which also have a lot of infection with people. We have already 43,000 sexological tests, with 371 positive cases. This allows us to control the situation and avoid the infections chain in people who are in the first line of the battle, which are the ones that take care of us. Thirdly, we are making a great effort to arrive with the plan detect all the neighborhoods of the city. Today we have it in 29 neighborhoods, which involve 80 percent of the infections, in the city. And it is a pride to say- and I want to tell the president, because I did not comment- that, since this week, since last Monday we are testing with the new tests, which arose from Conicet, made in the country and that they also have the advantage that the diagnostic time is much shorter and simpler; That helps give more volume to testing and the truth is that it is a pride that Argentine scientists have developed a cutting -edge technology, which today helps us in the fight against pandemic. And from this week we add a new form of testing, which is that we are testing to all the cohabitants of the infected; The experience of detecting and contact with epidemiological interviews shows a high level of contagion of the cohabiting. That is why we are going home by house looking for them, we start in Villa Ortúzar, Palermo, San Telmo, and we will take the same effort to all neighborhoods. And we also launched - something that I committed, at the last conference - a seroprevalence tests, which will allow us to determine the number of people who already infected in the city. There I clarify, we have had some questions of this, to all that we will go to test that it is a random sample, of course, we call it on the phone before, we send you a letter, but we ask them - please - that they collaborate because this information is very important to be able to have a clearer panorama at the level of the entire city. Any questions call 147. Now I want to clarify something: to the extent that we add more testing strategies, as you are, most likely more cases will be seen in statistics. That does not necessarily mean that we have more infected, but that we are getting to look for them more pointed house by house. And this allows us something fundamental, which is to isolate the infected, so that they do not continue to spread. A peak of up to 4,000 people, isolated in hotels; And in the center we have in Costa Salguero the number, yesterday, it was 3287 and this is also giving us information. Of the epidemiological interviews we are seeing, first one of the things, which only the president commented, that of the elderly today sources and risks of infections occurs in personal encounters, in this narrow contact, which is to be more than 15 minutes less than two meters away from a infected person. That, today, there is some consensus in the world, which is the main risk of infection and the other is that of mobility, that of public transport, which are closed places, where people necessarily travel very close to each other, for a long period. That is why we agree, with the National Government, with the province, remain more and more strict in mobility controls to guarantee, in public transport only essential workers can travel. We know that this is also a nuisance for all, but public transport is a place of much risk sensitivity. On the other hand, I want to tell you that we are also working with the national government in all the evidence to find the vaccine. Already in the city we recruit more than 700 volunteers, because there are many people who want to collaborate. It is a very difficult time for everyone, but more difficult than anyone is for families, who have lost their loved ones. That is why I also want to send them a few words of love, support, condolences to all who are the hardest spending it in this situation. Two weeks ago, in this same room, I commented that we started a comprehensive plan to start the city, with which we already add some activities that are working; We work together with all sectors, with experts, we incorporate the gender perspective, which is very important and we gave enormous priority to outdoor activities, which is tested today, that the risk of infection is much lower outdoors, it is never zero, we have to take care of ourselves but is less. And today, thanks to that, we have businesses that are open in the city, fulfilling their protocols, with very few people inside, the people queue outside, two meters of each; The hairdressers resumed the activities, where there is double care, because they have to put on the chin and also the mask, also entering very little people at a time. With the reopening of the Judicial Fair we had to allow lawyers, to return, but once a week to their studies, but also with a limited amount of people at a time. Another important item for health is that of psychologists, psychopedagogues, therapists; They can also resume face -to -face attention in those cases where it is essential that it be face -to -face, but always with a lot of protocol; For example with people with autistic spectrum disorders who need personal contact. The boys can continue to go outdoors, that has already been determined as a priority. For them, in addition, two weeks ago we opened the squares, not for them to stay but so that they have more space to maintain the distance that is needed. Now, all this is accompanied by a lot of the State, in public space, with firefighters, police, inspectors, square guardians, with a lot of voluntary staff, who help us help people to maintain distance and ensure that we take care of that. Now all this requires enormous care and responsibility, we can only do this, we can only keep it. In the city of Buenos Aires - I must say - it is weird, very rare to see people without the chin and the truth that people look at two meters from each other, but it requires everyone's commitment, the only way to sustain it, to be able to live with the virus, we took an important step but we can only do it by trusting each of us. In that I want to thank those who live, in the city, the shops that comply with these protocols, the people who when they go to the squares take care of their distances. We know that, sometimes, there are many measures, very precise, very in details, but it is the only way we have with very strict protocols for being able to take care of each other. Tomorrow we are going to give, as we always do, a press conference, in the city, going a little more in details with all the measures and with everything, but we are at a high level of number of cases, stabilized in terms of the dynamics, but high in number of cases, the virus circulates in all neighborhoods of the city. We have to be very careful and very prudent. To consolidate this first stage, it only depends on the attitude of each of us, we all know about the anguish that this supposes, in uncertainty, we have been making a very great effort that we cannot throw it overboard. As a society we have to share the responsibility of taking care of each other, to take care of each one, and that is decided in each attitude, there is no possibility that the control of the State, that we are going to do it in the best possible way, replace the action and individual responsibility, the only way to get out of this is to leave together, is the only way. I trusted all the Buenos Aires, I trust that each one takes care of each other, but it is the decision of each of us. That is why I ask them to take care of their loved ones, to take care of their friends, their relatives, their coworkers, to take care of each other. Thank you so much.
Kicillof.- Good afternoon. I want to start again thanking the people of the province of Buenos Aires, all and all Buenos Aires, I am not going to tire of doing it because I know all the effort, I also know all the solidarity that is really putting in a moment of difficulties and many uncertainty. I want to tell you that I am proud to be governor of a province like the province of Buenos Aires, which was often pointed out, but that in the worst moments what he did is multiply solidarity and also multiply the effort. Seriously thanks.
At this time, the news that arrives from the coronavirus world is discouraging, they are bad, the world is living in the most infected days globally, the 17 million infected have already been exceeded, and we are close to the 700 thousand dead throughout the planet, it is very much. And besides the truth is that not only has not been overcome, but the Coronavirus goes and returns in all countries. What we are seeing is how those countries that seemed to have controlled the infections, today have the regrowths or a move of the virus of some regions to others, so that as we said here in the AMBA, there is an intermittent quarantine in the world. It is seen in the United States, which has determined red areas, 18 states, among which Texas, California and Florida stand out, which have a third of the entire population of the country. Today in the United States there are more cases than there for March, then they have made decisions even practically curfew to avoid contagions. The same in Israel, which seemed exempt, and are now with restaurants, shops, back back. Spain, new regions, particularly the Basque Country, Catalonia at this time with strict quarantine in Barcelona. Australia, another place where he seemed already freed from the virus and is not so. Germany, several regions. In China, in Beijín, an outbreak appears again for a food market and again restrictive measures. I say this because there are those who sell that the pandemic has already passed, in the same way that yesterday we learned that the US economy suffered a fall in its internal gross product of 33 percent, is the largest fall in recent seventy years, but do you know what? It is one of the last seventy years because statistics began in 97, that is, it is the largest recorded today in American statistics, and it is funny sometimes, or we could say tragic, see how some media title. When the economy falls into a foreign country, it is the fault of the pandemic, when there are economic problems in Argentina it is quarantine, it shows a lot what they are pointing out, luckily they are not so many, there are few, but unfortunately those lies and those manipulations cannot be accepted, which is damaging the international health and economy is pure and simply a virus, before unknown, that has no cure and has no vaccine.
And I also know that the mood of all of us sometimes fits, but I want to emphasize and show again how much it served what we did, we have to assess the thousands of lives that were saved today. In those cities where the Coronavirus arrived and began to spread, he mentioned two: New York or Madrid. In New York the first cases were seen in mid -March, and a month later, in mid -April, they had 7,500 cases in New York City, in a month, there is no time, there is no way to face a pandemic with that speed, the same Madrid, the first cases begin at the beginning of March, and on March 27 they have 3,500 cases. Why do I mention this? Because the main problem in terms of mortality but also of infections is when it is fleeting, as lightning, because there is no time to prepare the health system, there is no time to learn to use and change customs to wash your hands more, to take distance, to make the tail leaving between one person and another two meters, there is no time, and there is no time to expand the ability to bed , when there are no doctors, nurses, when there are no respirators, then there is no way to care for patients. And these were the overflows in many of the places in the world, and that we avoid it in a single way, which is with the quarantine that Alberto determined and that we carry out in all the Argentine provinces, it is with the cultural change that the coronavirus brought us. It is with the application of the health system. Now I go to our situation, before the Coronavirus, before the quarantine, before the pandemic, in December of last year we had 883 beds in the public sector of intensive adult therapy, 883 beds in the province of Buenos Aires. Today we have 1,979 beds, more than we duplicate, 889, 1979, but do you know how many internships there are today in the province of Buenos Aires? 1130, in adult intensive therapy beds, we would already be overflow We had time, we had a very weak, very fragile system, we strengthen it. It was Alberto's decision, it was what we did in the province along with 135 mayors, it was also because the ruling and opposition could work together, and it was mainly because of what the 17 million Buenos Aires did, the enormous sacrifice, the enormous effort and the enormous conscience, that is what allowed us to strengthen the health system but also to spread much less than what happened in other places and avoid a much greater tragedy .
What is the situation today? The AMBA, the metropolitan field of Buenos Aires, is a single health region, so there is no way to divide us, so there is no way that they make us fight, it is the same, the virus crosses the general peace when it wants, and that is why the disease does, and that is why the numbers that Alberto are just liked are like that, and what Horacio said just also, the disease is taught in those places where there are more population Where there is more population per square kilometer, it is so and it is inevitable, it happened in all the great metropolis. That is why we have a third cord of the conurbano that today has a positive every 200 people; We have a third cord with a positive every 200, I go out of the outside. A second cord with a infected registered every 130; A first cord with one every 100, and a city of Buenos Aires with one every 50, do you know where the problem is? That the virus expands, if today we saw the same density, the same intensity as in the city of Buenos Aires only in the conurbano we tended 250 thousand infections, just by copying what is happening, as it also begins to happen in the nearby regions, there in Santa Fe, because the virus expands, because the virus radiates. That is what we are trying to avoid at all costs, you can't do different things on one side and the other of General Paz. That is why I thank Alberto for having created this environment so that with all the governors, and mainly with the Head of Government, we can work in this coordination, and I thank Horacio also because we have been able to advance with policies that despite the differences that separate us in the ideological, in the party, today we could dedicate ourselves pure and simply to take care of people and take care of their health. Do not try to politicize the pandemic, because we are showing that this is the wrong way, we are working so that on one side and the other of General Paz no very serious problems such as those that were lived on other sides are generated. That is why today we also have a situation that still gives us a margin, for having worked so intensely. The private sector, which is basically social works, prepaid, is basically worried, and is basically in the city of Buenos Aires, these day listened to one of its headlines to talk about one hundred percent occupation, 85 percent occupation, on average that private system, which is in the city of Buenos Aires but we share it because there are many members of prepaid that are on the other side of General Paz. That is why they are not two different problems, it is the same, they want to be addressed in the clinics that are in the city of Buenos Aires, but who have them as partners on the other side, so today they have 73, 74 percent of occupation, it is a lot, and it is not their fault, and that is what worries us, the occupation of the public system in the city and of the province is lower, but of course, in the city two third It supports a more important proportion of the population. Then there have been unexpected cases, as Alberto mentioned, said by the head of the PAMI, there is Vece that a PAMI affiliate in the city of Buenos Aires finds a bed in the province, because there is its network of clinics, of sanatorium One side and the other, because it is the same system, because it is the same health region, because it is an urban continuum, do not look for more laps, it is how we have to work and we are doing so.
We refer to a situation like the concept of intermittent quarantine, but it is not just to prevent the health system from being devoured, it is to prevent more people from being infected, Alberto said today, because today we do not know the sequels that may exist in mild patients, we do not know. And it is not scary, as some say, it is to inform and tell the truth, not to create fear but to create awareness, so that it is well understood what it is, what we are faced, what the risks and what are the dangers. We know that in some places the quarantine became tremendously effective, people kept because they saw frightful, dantesque, corpses in stacked streets, Argentines can be more than that, we do not have to wait for this to happen to know the risk we run, we are anticipating, with individual behaviors and collective and social behaviors. We continue in the province of Buenos Aires with the same degree of opening, limited, careful, with protocols, with low use of public transport, we continue as we come, we decided with the intendants of the AMBA. Inside we continue too., Five phases system, almost one hundred municipalities and in a situation of very low circulation in many of them, but with Mu Chisma Opening. But in Greater Buenos Aires we continued as we came, with the restrictions we had, but with more tests, the other day we did almost 8 thousand tests, we multiplied by three, by four the capacity of tests, very quickly. We continue with the follow -up of narrow contacts, we multiply by five telephone calls. We continue with the isolation beds, we have 13 thousand in the province, opened by the municipal mayors. We need that as soon as possible the one that is infected or suspected to be infected to be isolated, if you do not have it in their homes the conditions to do so we will help you and contribute so that you can do it in one of these isolation shelters.
I also ask that we have a more human vision, we have talked a lot about numbers, we have done and shown graphics and curves, but behind each of those numbers there are people. I will give a fact: in Argentina today we regret 3,437 deaths, we send our condolences again, our accompaniment to families, but know that 618 of the 3,400 are under 60 years, it is twenty percent, no one has a void probability that the disease takes a serious way and hopefully does not end in the worst way. Behind each of the dead there is a family, more when they are young, but even a study that was done in the United States shows that those who die from the Coronavirus do so before they were going to touch them for statistics. There is a number that struck me a lot, those who died from the Coronavirus lost on average eleven years of life, if I had not grabbed this disease, perhaps with health difficulties, perhaps some with an advanced age but in perfect health, age is not an indicator of disease, and died by the crown. Let's not let ourselves only by the numbers, let's think what this is seriously, because we have been the other day July., A patient, who recovered thanks to plasma, he told me, I will tell me because it struck me a lot, that he saw that light that some reflect when they were on the verge of death, but I was not in those conditions, three weeks in respirator, three weeks with his sustained life thanks to medical means. And we attribute to plasma., Which cannot be used in all cases, is a specific treatment for some cases. The same José. And the two told me that they did not know how they had infected, they said "but in my house we went out only to the supermarket." So it is not less or a simple issue, we are in front of the largest pandemic and the economic crisis produced by a larger pandemic in recent history, surely, one hundred years ago you have to go to find something similar in terms of epidemic.
Where is hope then? Hope I think is in the vaccine, in Los Remedios, and has worked against clock, and we have been able to do it in Argentina because we believe in science and because, I have to say, this government, the national government and that of the province of Buenos Aires all on our scientists, and today trying vaccines, some say that you can get soon, we expect that, that will be the final answer. You cannot try to expect that naturally loosen or stop, because it has not passed anywhere. Meanwhile, it is not about getting angry with each other, obviously, this is long, fatigue, weariness, anxiety, anguish bring carelessness, and I don't want to talk about those who have that and irresponsible position of challenging the disease and others and infected and infecting themselves, I speak of those who relax or loosen. They can commit carelessness, but know well that if the numbers do not go down, v to have to go to a much harder quarantine, because if not the beds are filled we can not allow anyone to stay without the attention it deserves as a right.
Today we cannot choose whether or not to have the pandemic, what we can choose is if we let it work alone, if we let it do or if as a society and state we will do something against the pandemic, and that is how we have been doing in Argentina and in the province of Buenos Aires, protect ourselves and work collectively, there is less, let's not lower our arms now, please, let's continue taking care of us. Thank you.
President.- Thank you very much Horacio, thank you very much Axel, some last words. First I remind you that we are going to extend this until August 19; Second, as Axel said, we continue working hard to see if science reaches us the remedy that allows us to cure those who get sick. We are going to keep the ATP and we will keep the IFE for all who need it, nobody thinks that the State will leave you and forget about you at this time, and as we just talked to Horacio, we will make our meetings more frequent in the week to make a closer monitoring.
Let me end a reflection: this meeting that we had today with Horacio and Axel lasted 61 minutes, if we took into account yesterday's data, in this little while 268 Argentines were infected. And if we take into account yesterday's dead, four Argentines died in this little while. That is the coronavirus, let's not neglect, the problem we do not overcome. I ask everyone for the maximum responsibility. Today, the decree of necessity and urgency that provides the new sanitary rules will be signed, they will notice that social meetings will be prohibited, and those who carry them out know that they can incur the criminal responsibility of being transmitting a disease.
We thank everyone, with all responsibility, let's start this stage that begins. Thank you very much to all.

topics_ES: Palabras del Presidente de la Nación, Alberto Fernández, por la apertura del Plenario Nacional de la CTA
speeches_ES:
Estamos viviendo un tiempo difícil, un tiempo único en la Argentina y en el mundo, un tiempo que nos obliga a repensar no sólo el presente, sino fundamentalmente el futuro. El presente de por sí es un presente muy complejo, es un presente que está signado por la incertidumbre, nadie sabe a ciencia cierta dónde está el final de este tiempo de enfermedad que nos toca vivir, nadie lo sabe, francamente. No lo sabe la Argentina, no lo sabe el Gobierno, no lo sabe la oposición, nadie lo sabe. Lo que sí sabemos es que tenemos que dar esta pelea preservando la salud de la gente, que es lo primero y central a nuestro juicio. No tiene sentido pensar en un futuro donde la gente ya no esté entre nosotros, no tiene mucho sentido pensar en un futuro donde en las fábricas la gente vaya a enfermarse y no a buscar su sustento diario, que es lo que hace quien trabaja. Y con esa lógica, nosotros hemos venido todo este tiempo sosteniendo y ayudando en la medida de lo que el Estado nacional puede, que insisto es muy complejo, porque hemos recibido un Estado absolutamente destruido, en condiciones francamente patéticas. Pero con todo nos hemos puesto una obligación que es la obligación de preservar las empresas y se preservar las fuentes de trabajo, que aquel que esté trabajando, bueno, tenga la tranquilidad de que el Estado ayude a su empleador a pagarle su sueldo, hasta tanto este mal momento pase y todo vuelva a la normalidad. Y para muchas pequeñas y medianas empresas, que son las más beneficiadas con estas políticas, la realidad para ellas ha sido un gran alivio. Muchas en la necesidad se reconvirtieron, y es muy impactante ver muchas empresas textiles que estaban pensando hacer otras cosas, tuvieron que dedicarse a hacer barbijos o camisolines para enfermeras, o zapatos de esos tipo… cubre zapatos, esos que usan en los hospitales. Y todos tuvieron que hacer un esfuerzo enorme para adaptarse a esta nueva realidad ¿Cuánto tiempo más nos queda de pandemia? Sólo Dios lo sabe. Lo que sí sé es que nosotros hemos logrado preservar, con la cuarentena temprana, muchas vidas de argentinos y de eso tenemos que estar todos muy orgullosos y muy convencidos, porque sin esa cuarentena temprana hoy estaríamos contando otros resultados, esta es la verdad. Y no es que nosotros fuimos particularmente inteligentes al tomar esa medida, simplemente vimos lo que hicieron otros e hicimos lo contrario. Vimos lo que pasó en Europa, en países como España o Italia, e hicimos lo contrario. Cuando ellos pusieron las cuarentenas estrictas ya era muy tarde y el virus se había difundido mucho. Y estamos en un tiempo donde el virus está apareciendo con más frecuencia, no sé si con más fuerza, pero si con más frecuencia, y eso nos obliga a estar atentos, porque eso lo único que nos da cuenta es que el problema está lejos de haberse terminado. Ahora, yo siempre digo que la pandemia dejó al descubierto muchas cosas que los argentinos o muchos argentinos no querían ver. La desigualdad fundamentalmente es lo que dejó al descubierto, puso sobre la mesa lo injusto del sistema social argentino. Y yo cuento una anécdota que tengo como Presidente, que es el día que hablamos por primera vez de llevar adelante la puesta en marcha de un Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia, el IFE. Y dijimos, “¿a cuánta gente va a alcanzar el IFE?”, y los primeros cálculos dijeron que van a alcanzar a 600 mil tributistas y alrededor de un millón y medio, dos millones de personas que están fuera del sistema, que no están amparadas por ningún plan social, por ninguna jubilación, gente que efectivamente está sin recibir ningún auxilio del Estado. Y así empezamos, convencidos que el IFE iba a llegar a dos o dos millones y medio de personas, y de repente vimos que ese número crecía, crecía, crecía, y cuándo veía que crecía decía “pero cómo puede ser que crezca esto así”. Algunos me decían que “lo que pasa es que debe haber estudiantes de universidades, que no trabajan y que sólo se dedican a estudiar, y que los mantienen sus padres, y esto debe ser la causa”. Pero el número siguió creciendo, creciendo, creciendo, y llegamos a nueve millones de argentinos. Y así descubrimos que en Argentina durante, no sé cuánto tiempo, hubo nueve millones de argentinos a los que el Estado no registraba, directamente no registraba, nueve millones de argentinos que estaban tratando de llevarla como podían, sin ningún auxilio del Estado y sin ninguna perspectiva de futuro. Porque es gente que claro se ha quedado tan al margen de la sociedad, tan al margen, que toda idea de volver al sistema con trabajo propio o con proyectos propios, se convierte en casi una quimera, dura lo que dura un sueño. Nosotros creo que vimos, lo marco siempre lo que pasó con el IFE, como experiencia personal se la transmito a ustedes, para que entendamos de una vez por todas que nosotros no podemos seguir viviendo en ese país, ese es un país profundamente injusto. Y nadie que haya abrazado la política, como abrazamos todos nosotros la política, ustedes la política sindical, algunos la política partidaria como yo, pero los que abrazamos la política no podemos quedar ausentes del debate que supone integrar a todos los sectores de la sociedad a la sociedad argentina. Esto que llamamos inclusión, proyectar un país en el que todo estén incluidos y no solamente algunos. Una sociedad, digo siempre yo, es un acuerdo donde dos partes se unen para lograr un objetivo, ahora condición de la sociedad es que los dos que se unen, se unan para ganar los dos, porque si en la sociedad esa gana uno y el otro pierde eso me parece más a una estafa que a una sociedad. Y yo siento que los argentinos no hemos hecho la sociedad que nos merecíamos, yo siento que los argentinos hemos permitido que algunos ganan mucho y que muchos pierdan mucho más. Y por la causa que sea fuimos contemplando esa realidad, y sin tomar las decisiones, sin tomar las acciones que son imperiosas tomar para encarar el futuro. La pandemia en el mundo también nos deja muchas reflexiones. La primera reflexión es que el sistema económico mundial era una fragilidad enorme, enorme, pero tan enorme que un virus imperceptible a la vista humana derrumbó imperios económicos. Nosotros hace cinco, seis meses, en el mundo, los argentinos también vivimos anotando cuántos se enferman y cuántos mueren, y hemos dejado de contar cuántas empresas se caen, cómo están los bonos de las grandes potencias del mundo. Porque si viéramos todo eso, la lista de empresas muertas son muchísimas, la cantidad de empresas debilitadas económicamente son muchísimas, y los bonos de las grandes potencias bajan, bajan, bajan, algún día suben porque piensan que pasó el coronavirus, y al día siguiente hay un rebrote y vuelven a bajar, a una velocidad increíble. Esa economía, ¿por qué era tan débil? Porque era una economía ficticia, era una economía fundada en cuestiones financieras, en especulación financiera. La especulación financiera no es patrimonio de la Argentina, es patrimonio de un capitalismo que en determinado momento le prestó más atención a lo financiero que a lo productivo, y lo verdaderamente sólido de una empresa, es lo productivo. Cuando una empresa invierte en montar una fábrica, en comprar maquinarias, en pagarle al personal para que haga trabajar todo eso, esa empresa ahí tiene sus verdaderos activos. Cuando una empresa empieza a prestarle menos atención a eso, a lograr resultados produciendo y vendiendo, y empieza a prestarle más atención a la timba financiera, a ir a la Bolsa y ver la diferencia que hace con unos bonos, el capitalismo definitivamente empieza debilitarse y las empresas empiezan a tener valor. Y todo el valor se pincha, como se pincha un globo, porque la teoría de los globos, la famosa crisis del año 2008, cuando la burbuja hipotecaria explotó, era eso, era una riqueza inflada sin contenido real. El virus lo que dejó en evidencia una vez más es la debilidad de esa economía en el mundo, la debilidad y la desigualdad. Y sabemos que hoy estamos además en el continente más desigual del mundo, y encima estamos en el momento en que la pandemia ataca al continente más desigual del mundo, que es América Latina. Hemos aprendido también otras cosas de la pandemia, hemos aprendido que todo eso que llamábamos medio ambiente y formas de producir no contaminantes tenían algún sentido ¿Y cómo lo descubrimos? Lo descubrimos el día que nos enjaulamos nosotros, cuando nos enjaulamos nosotros y nos quedamos en nuestras casas las aguas se transparentaron, los ríos empezaron a mejorar la calidad del agua porque la contaminación bajaba, el aire que respiramos se volvió más puro, porque dejamos de quemar los gases propios de quemar combustibles fósiles y la vida en el globo terráqueo se volvió mejor. Entonces, uno tiene acá, tomando todo esto en cuenta, la posibilidad de pensar otro mundo, un mundo más equilibrado, porque con esta lógica no ha ganado nadie. A Estados Unidos se les murieron decenas de miles de personas y sus bonos se cayeron estrepitosamente, y las acciones de sus empresas cayeron estrepitosamente, lo mismo pasa en Alemania, lo mismo pasa en España. Nadie ha quedado inmune a este problema. Y cuando en la cumbre del cambio climático que se hizo en París hace algunos años atrás, nos decían “no podemos empezar a sustituir combustibles fósiles por combustibles orgánicos, porque eso significaría una caída para el Producto Bruto Mundial de alrededor de 4 puntos”. Bueno, yo recuero ese debate y miro que apareció un virus e hizo caer el PBI mundial cerca de 10 puntos y digo, “¿qué era lo que estábamos discutiendo? ¿Qué era lo que estábamos discutiendo?”. Yo creo que el coronavirus finalmente nos ha dejado la oportunidad de hacer las cosas de otro modo, de construir de otra forma la Argentina. Días atrás hablaba con los movimientos sociales y les contaba que a mí me costaba entender mucho su lógica de la economía popular, que no entendía a que llamaban ellos economía popular, que en los términos que uno manejaba se parecía también más a la informalidad de la economía, que a otra cosa. Claro, después fui entendiendo que en la economía popular hay un montón de actores, que difícilmente puedan volver a sumarse a la economía tal como nosotros la conocemos, y que por lo tanto hay que darle una institución distinta a esa economía popular. Y les decía que cuando ellos me hablaban de la economía popular, como la hoja de la economía que estaba escrita, yo miraba y decía, “¿y dónde meto en la hoja de la economía, la economía popular?” ¿Saben qué siento ahora? Siento que la hoja de la economía está blanca, está totalmente blanca y somos nosotros los que tenemos que escribirla, y tenemos que rescribirla de otro modo. Tenemos que rescribirla pensando en un gran acuerdo, que somos una sociedad y por eso el gran acuerdo es importante, en un gran acuerdo donde todos seamos actores, donde todos seamos partícipes y donde todos ganemos, donde todos ganemos; no un acuerdo donde algunos ganan y otros pierden, o algunos ganan la gran tajada y otros se llevan los restos de las ganancias de otros. Y eso hay que construirlo, hay que construirlo. A veces me cuestionan y me dicen que “lo que pasas es que vos sos muy dialoguista y en verdad hay que tomar decisiones, y quisiéramos decisiones rápidas”. Yo creo que es un tiempo en que las decisiones hay que construirlas, no hay que imponerlas, hay que construirlas, y para construirlas hace falta que todos tengamos voz en el escenario, que todos tengamos voto en el escenario y que todos podamos participar del escenario. Porque créanme que es una gran tentación tener una lapicera de firmar decretos y de promulgar leyes, pero lo que más quisiera es que haya un acuerdo entre todos nosotros sobre el país en el que queremos vivir, sobre qué sociedad queremos construir, si alguno de nosotros francamente está en paz con su conciencia, viendo la inequidad que cotidianamente vemos, si alguno de nosotros piensa realmente que la solución a tanta inequidad es que el Estado le aporte 10 mil pesos solamente, sólo 10 mil pesos por mes en concepto de IFE a quién está necesitando. Yo creo que todos nosotros no queremos ese país, queremos un país integrado, queremos un país en el que todos tengamos voz, queremos un país en el que todos votemos, queremos un país que podamos construirlo de nuevo, reconstruirlo de nuevo. No estoy invitando a ninguna locura, estoy invitando a repensar a partir de lo que quedó en evidencia, cómo es el país que queremos construir. Y allí ustedes, dirigentes gremiales, tienen mucho que dar, mucho que hacer. Hugo sabe el afecto personal que le tengo y el respeto que le tengo, y el respeto tengo generalmente por todos los dirigentes de la CTA, él lo sabe, son auténticos dirigentes sindicales y yo los valoro enormemente. Y ustedes tiene que ser actores centrales en este tiempo que se viene, no tiene, que estar ausentes, porque además tienen gremios importantísimos en sus manos. Me paro un segundo en el gremio de la educación, la educación tiene que ver indefectiblemente con el futuro argentino, ninguna sociedad puede pensar un futuro sin educación, porque la riqueza de las sociedades hoy en día está en la educación y el conocimiento, no está en otro lado, está allí, está allí, y tenemos que hacer una gran educación para toda la Argentina desde el Estado, desde el Estado. Eso es lo que tenemos que hacer, eso es lo que tenemos que construir. Ayer Agustín Rossi me contaba cómo habían hecho un sable, que es una réplica del sable que usó Belgrano que es maravilloso, realmente un trabajo de orfebrería maravilloso que me regalaron días atrás. Esta no es la anécdota, le pregunté dónde lo hacían y me contó que lo hacían en un taller que tiene las Fuerzas Armadas, y que es un taller que creó Sarmiento, pero Sarmiento antes de hacer el taller y de construir un pueblo en torno al taller, ¿saben qué hizo? Una escuela. Y en ese momento, los pueblos crecían en torno a la escuela, ¿qué era lo que se les garantizaba primero a los que iban a vivir a ese pueblo? Educación. Miren, si la educación era central allá por el 1800, fines del 1800 cuando vivo Sarmiento y gobernó Sarmiento, dense cuenta lo central que es ahora que la tecnología avanza a una velocidad increíble. Nosotros no podemos dejar a nuestros chicos sin la preparación que necesitan en esta carrera de ciencia y tecnología que se ha desatado en el mundo, y ustedes tienen que ver mucho con eso, y tienen mucho que hacer. Y tienen también la presentación de los empleados del Estado, hay muchos empleados del Estado y también tenemos que pensar juntos cómo hacer un Estado inteligente, un Estado inteligente no es un Estado chiquito, no es esa la discusión. Un Estado inteligente, es un Estado del que no se rían los poderosos, eso es un Estado inteligente. Es un Estado que preserve la igualdad, que intervenga cuando tiene que intervenir para preservar la igualdad, que no permite que nadie se abuse del otro, que no permita que la posición dominante de alguno la pague el ciudadano, que no permita los monopolios, eso es un Estado inteligente, eso es. Y para eso también tenemos que tener de nuestro lado una serie de cuadros técnicos y de profesionales de la administración pública, que acompañen la construcción de ese Estado. Todo esto son temas que tenemos que abordar para adelante, son temas que tenemos que pensar juntos, y ustedes tienen que ser protagonistas centrales de este debate, centrales. Yo siempre le digo a Hugo Yasky, le digo a todos los sindicalistas, que me encantaría que así como pudimos lograr la unidad de política con Cristina, con Sergio, que pudieron lograr la unidad de quienes trabajan, porque así se hacen más fuertes los que trabajan. Pero más allá de eso, sobre lo que yo no puedo expresar más que un deseo porque no soy quién para resolverlo, quiero decirles que ustedes tienen ahí un protagonismo muy muy grande y que tenemos que hacerlo junto, y tenemos que estar más juntos que nunca. Y que cuando quieren hacernos creer que por qué Alberto habla con uno, y no llamó al mismo tiempo al otro, nunca dejen olvidar que Alberto sabe a quiénes representa, y que Alberto sabe perfectamente bien qué intereses representa, y que Alberto sabe perfectamente bien que del otro lado de la pantalla, todas esas caritas que estoy mirando quieren construir el mismo país que yo. Y que yo cuento con ustedes y ustedes deben contar conmigo, porque el primer compromiso lo tengo con lo que nos votaron que son ustedes, y de esto no deben dudar. Y cada vez que nos hacen dudar y nos hacen sentir que en verdad no podemos convivir con nuestras diferencias, recordemos los que nos pasó. Cuando nos convencieron de eso Macri fue Presidente, no tenemos nunca más que volver a caer en eso. Hoy a la mañana leí un artículo de Eduardo Aliverti en Página 12, que me pareció maravilloso, que habla de estas cosas, que habla del esfuerzo que hacen algunos por convencernos que somos distintos, por ver si Alberto le presta más atención a Hugo Yasky, o a Héctor Daer, o a Moyano, o a Palazzo, son todos compañeros, y todos tienen que estar adentro, y no deben dividirnos más. Y si la coyuntura nos divide ya habrá tiempo para juntarnos, pero tenemos objetivos muchos más importantes que la coyuntura que cumplir, tenemos tareas que cumplir mucho más trascendentes que la coyuntura de la división, que no nos hagan equivocar, que no nos enfrenten, estemos más unidos que nunca. Para mí, cuando el otro día Hugo me propuso tener esta charla, yo inmediatamente le dije que sí, porque me parecía muy importante poder hablarles a todos, y yo le agradezco a Hugo la gentileza que tuvo de darme estos minutos para que yo pueda hablar con todos ustedes, con todos y todas ustedes. Y la verdad que sepan que acá tienen un compañero que ocasionalmente ejerce la Presidencia, pero que nunca se olvida que es un compañero y que es un compañero de ustedes ¿De acuerdo? Y con mucha fuerza encarar el futuro porque como les dije no la tienen fácil, va a tener que trabajar mucho como todos nosotros para poder poner de pie a la Argentina otra vez. Así que les agradezco, tengo un ratito si alguno quiere decir algo, quiere preguntarme algo, quiere que comentemos algo, eso lo manejás vos, Hugo, que sos el maestro de ceremonia en este Zoom. Gracias a todos y todas de verdad por haberme escuchado. 
Fragmento de cierre tras las palabras de Hugo Yasky, secretario general de la CTA Bueno, muchas gracias, gracias Hugo querido. Primer punto, ustedes no están convocados, ustedes son parte de esto, ustedes son parte de esto. No necesitan que alguien los convoque, como digo yo, ustedes pueden entrar sin tocar el timbre porque son parte de toda esta historia, son parte de este proyecto. Y por lo tanto no necesitan que yo los convoque, saben que para mí siempre grato y me es muy útil poder pensar con ustedes. Quiero dejarle solamente mí compromiso con ustedes, agradecerles realmente la solidaridad y el acompañamiento que uno lo siente de corazón lo siente, y decirles que no aflojemos, que no nos confundan, que no nos dividan, que no nos separen, que en verdad lo más importante es que pensemos en los que peores están. Primero los últimos, como dije el 10 de diciembre cuando llegué, primeros los últimos, hagamos todo lo necesario para sacar de la pobreza a los hermanos argentinos que han dejado sus vidas en ella, para devolverle el trabajo y la dignidad a los que han perdido el trabajo. Esos son los primeros esfuerzos que debemos hacer. La Argentina no va a ser una buena sociedad si se conforma viviendo con tanta desigualdad y yo sé que ninguno de ustedes quiere eso, quieren lo mismo que yo, quieren una Argentina más igualitaria. Así que los abrazo de corazón, gracias en serio por el tiempo, gracias Hugo querido por la oportunidad, está muy bien esa idea que me planteaste días atrás de hacer una suerte de mesa con la pymes y con las centrales obreras, porque allí también está el futuro constructivo de la Argentina. El 80 por ciento del trabajo no lo dan las multinacionales, las dan las pequeñas y medianas empresas, así que allí está el futuro de la Argentina. Así que así a la distancia los abrazo, créanme que los quiero mucho y de verdad lo mejor para todo, y va a hacer lo mejor para el país. Gracias, compañeros y compañeras. Muchas gracias.
topics_EN: Words of the President of the Nation, Alberto Fernández, for the opening of the National Plenary of the CTA
speeches_EN:
We are living a difficult time, a unique time in Argentina and in the world, a time that forces us to rethink not only the present, but fundamentally the future. The present is a very complex present, is a present that is signed by uncertainty, nobody knows for sure where the end of this disease time is to live, nobody knows, frankly. Argentina does not know, the government does not know, the opposition does not know, nobody knows it. What we do know is that we have to give this fight preserving people's health, which is the first and central to our judgment. It makes no sense to think about a future where people are no longer among us, it does not make much sense to think about a future where people are getting sick in factories and not to look for their daily livelihood, which is what they work on. And with that logic, we have come all this time holding and helping to the extent of what the National State can, which I insist is very complex, because we have received an absolutely destroyed state, in frankly pathetic conditions. But with everything we have put an obligation that is the obligation to preserve companies and preserve the sources of work, that he who is working, well, has the peace of mind that the State helps its employer to pay for their salary, until this bad time passes and everything returns to normal. And for many small and medium enterprises, which are the most benefited with these policies, reality for them has been a great relief. Many in need were reconvirting, and it is very shocking to see many textile companies that were planning to do other things, they had to devote themselves to making chins or nightlims for nurses, or shoes of those type ... covers shoes, those that use in hospitals. And everyone had to make an enormous effort to adapt to this new reality. How much longer do we have pandemic? God only knows. What I do know is that we have managed to preserve, with the early quarantine, many lives of Argentines and that we have to be very proud and very convinced, because without that early quarantine today we would be telling other results, this is the truth. And it is not that we were particularly intelligent when taking that measure, we simply saw what others did and we did the opposite. We saw what happened in Europe, in countries like Spain or Italy, and we did otherwise. When they put the strict quarantine it was too late and the virus had spread a lot. And we are in a time where the virus is appearing more frequently, I do not know if with more force, but more often, and that forces us to be attentive, because that all that realizes us is that the problem is far from having ended. Now, I always say that pandemic exposed many things that Argentines or many Argentines did not want to see. The inequality is fundamentally what he exposed, he put on the table the unfair of the Argentine social system. And I tell an anecdote that I have as president, which is the day we talk for the first time to carry out the implementation of an emergency family income, the IFE. And we said, "How many people are going to reach IFE?", And the first calculations said they will reach 600 thousand taxi people and about a million and a half, two million people who are outside the system, who are not covered by any social plan, by any retirement, people who are effectively without receiving any help from the State. And so we started, convinced that the IFE was going to reach two or two and a half million people, and suddenly we saw that that number grew, grew, grew, and when I saw that it was growing, it said "but how it can be that this can grow so." Some told me that "what happens is that there must be students from universities, who do not work and that they only study, and that their parents keep them, and this must be the cause." But the number continued to grow, grow, grow, and we reached nine million Argentines. And so we discovered that in Argentina, I do not know how long, there were nine million Argentines to which the State did not register, it did not directly register, nine million Argentines who were trying to carry it as they could, without any help from the State and without any perspective for the future. Because they are people who of course have been so out of society, so outside, that every idea of ​​returning to the system with their own work or with their own projects, becomes almost a chimera, lasts what a dream lasts. We believe that we saw, it always marked what happened with the IFE, as a personal experience it is transmitted to you, so that we understand once and for all that we cannot continue living in that country, that is a deeply unfair country. And no one who has embraced politics, as we all embrace politics, you union policy, some partisan policy like me, but those who embrace politics cannot be absent from the debate that involves integrating all sectors of society into Argentine society. What we call inclusion, project a country in which everything is included and not just some. A society, I always say, it is an agreement where two parties come together to achieve a goal, now the condition of society is that the two who join, join to win both, because if in society that wins one and the other loses that seems more to me to a scam than to a society. And I feel that the Argentines have not made the society that we deserved, I feel that the Argentines have allowed some to win a lot and that many lose much more. And because of the cause we were contemplating that reality, and without making the decisions, without taking the actions that are imperious to take to face the future. Pandemia in the world also leaves us many reflections. The first reflection is that the world economic system was enormous, huge fragility, but so huge that an imperceptible virus in human view collapsed economic empires. We five months ago, in the world, Argentines also live scoring how many get sick and how many die, and we have stopped counting how many companies fall, how the bonds of the world's great powers are. Because if we saw all that, the list of dead companies are many, the amount of economically weakened companies are many, and the bonds of the great powers go down, go down, go down, one day they go up because they think that the coronavirus passed, and the next day there is a rebrote and fall again, at an incredible speed. That economy, why was it so weak? Because it was a fictitious economy, it was an economy based on financial issues, on financial speculation. Financial speculation is not the patrimony of Argentina, it is the heritage of capitalism that at a certain moment paid more attention to the productive than the productive, and the truly solid of a company is the productive. When a company invests in setting up a factory, in buying machinery, in paying the staff to make all that work, that company has its true assets. When a company begins to pay less attention to that, to achieve results producing and selling, and begins to pay more attention to the financial timba, to go to the stock market and see the difference it makes with bonds, capitalism definitely begins to weaken and companies begin to have value. And all the value is punctured, as a balloon is click, because the theory of balloons, the famous crisis of the year 2008, when the mortgage bubble exploded, it was that, it was an inflated wealth without real content. The virus that showed once again is the weakness of that economy in the world, weakness and inequality. And we know that today we are also in the most unequal continent in the world, and on top of that we are at the moment when the pandemic attacks the most unequal continent in the world, which is Latin America. We have also learned other things from pandemia, we have learned that all that we called the environment and ways of producing non -pollutants made any sense and how we discovered it? We discovered it the day we caged ourselves, when we caged and we stayed in our homes the waters transparent, the rivers began to improve the quality of the water because the pollution went down, the air we breathe became purer, because we stopped burning the gases of burning fossil fuels and the life in the globe became better. So, one has here, taking all this into account, the possibility of thinking about another world, a more balanced world, because with this logic no one has won. Tens of thousands of people were died and their bonds fell out lined, and the actions of their companies fell loudly, the same happens in Germany, the same goes for in Spain. No one has been immune to this problem. And when at the top of climate change that was made in Paris a few years ago, they told us "we cannot start replacing fossil fuels with organic fuels, because that would mean a fall for the global gross product of around 4 points." Well, I recourse that debate and look that a virus appeared and made the world GDP fall about 10 points and say, “What were we discussing? What were we discussing? I believe that the Coronavirus has finally left us the opportunity to do things in another way, to build Argentina differently. Days ago I spoke with social movements and told them that it was hard for me to understand their logic of the popular economy, which I did not understand that they called popular economy, that in the terms one managed, it also looked more like the informality of the economy, than to something else. Of course, I was understanding that in the popular economy there are a lot of actors, which can hardly join the economy as we know it, and therefore we must give a different institution to that popular economy. And he told them that when they told me about the popular economy, such as the sheet of the economy that was written, I looked and said, "And where do I put in the economy sheet, the popular economy?" Do you know what I feel now? I feel that the economy sheet is white, is totally white and we are the ones who have to write it, and we have to rewrite it otherwise. We have to rewrite it thinking about a great agreement, that we are a company and that is why the great agreement is important, in a great agreement where we are all actors, where we are all participants and where we all win, where we all win; Not an agreement where some win and others lose, or some win the great slice and others take the remains of the profits of others. And that must be built, you have to build it. Sometimes they question me and they tell me that "what you pass is that you are very dialogue and you really have to make decisions, and we would like quick decisions." I believe that it is a time when decisions must be built, we must not impose them, we must build them, and to build them we need to have voice on stage, that we all have a vote on stage and that we can all participate in the stage. Because believe me that it is a great temptation to have a pen to sign decrees and promulgate laws, but what I would like most is that there is an agreement between all of us on the country in which we want IFE who he is needing. I believe that all of us do not want that country, we want an integrated country, we want a country in which we all have a voice, we want a country where we all vote, we want a country that we can build it again, rebuild it again. I am not inviting any madness, I am inviting to rethink from what was evidenced, how is the country we want to build. And there you, union leaders, have a lot to give, much to do.
